text: CHRONOLOGY
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: After long and patient research I am still unable to give to the reader
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: of these Chronicles the exact date of the times that they tell of. Were
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: it merely a matter of history there could be no doubts about the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: period; but where magic is concerned, to however slight an extent,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: there must always be some element of mystery, arising partly out of
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: ignorance and partly from the compulsion of those oaths by which magic
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: protects its precincts from the tiptoe of curiosity.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Moreover, magic, even in small quantities, appears to affect time, much
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: as acids affect some metals, curiously changing its substance, until
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: dates seem to melt into a mercurial form that renders them elusive even
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: to the eye of the most watchful historian.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: It is the magic appearing in Chronicles III and IV that has gravely
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: affected the date, so that all I can tell the reader with certainty of
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the period is that it fell in the later years of the Golden Age in
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Spain.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: DON RODRIGUEZ
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: THE FIRST CHRONICLE
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: HOW HE MET AND SAID FAREWELL TO MINE HOST OF THE DRAGON AND KNIGHT
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Being convinced that his end was nearly come, and having lived long on
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: earth (and all those years in Spain, in the golden time), the Lord of
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the Valleys of Arguento Harez, whose heights see not Valladolid, called
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: for his eldest son. And so he addressed him when he was come to his
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: chamber, dim with its strange red hangings and august with the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: splendour of Spain: "O eldest son of mine, your younger brother being
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: dull and clever, on whom those traits that women love have not been
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: bestowed by God; and know my eldest son that here on earth, and for
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: ought I know Hereafter, but certainly here on earth, these women be the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: arbiters of all things; and how this be so God knoweth only, for they
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: are vain and variable, yet it is surely so: your younger brother then
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: not having been given those ways that women prize, and God knows why
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: they prize them for they are vain ways that I have in my mind and that
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: won me the Valleys of Arguento Harez, from whose heights Angelico swore
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: he saw Valladolid once, and that won me moreover also ... but that is
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: long ago and is all gone now ... ah well, well ... what was I saying?"
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And being reminded of his discourse, the old lord continued, saying,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "For himself he will win nothing, and therefore I will leave him these
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: my valleys, for not unlikely it was for some sin of mine that his
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: spirit was visited with dullness, as Holy Writ sets forth, the sins of
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the fathers being visited on the children; and thus I make him amends.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: But to you I leave my long, most flexible, ancient Castilian blade,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: which infidels dreaded if old songs be true. Merry and lithe it is, and
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: its true temper singeth when it meets another blade as two friends sing
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: when met after many years. It is most subtle, nimble and exultant; and
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: what it will not win for you in the wars, that shall be won for you by
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: your mandolin, for you have a way with it that goes well with the old
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: airs of Spain. And choose, my son, rather a moonlight night when you
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: sing under those curved balconies that I knew, ah me, so well; for
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: there is much advantage in the moon. In the first place maidens see in
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the light of the moon, especially in the Spring, more romance than you
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: might credit, for it adds for them a mystery to the darkness which the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: night has not when it is merely black. And if any statue should gleam
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: on the grass near by, or if the magnolia be in blossom, or even the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: nightingale singing, or if anything be beautiful in the night, in any
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: of these things also there is advantage; for a maiden will attribute to
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: her lover all manner of things that are not his at all, but are only
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: outpourings from the hand of God. There is this advantage also in the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: moon, that, if interrupters come, the moonlight is better suited to the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: play of a blade than the mere darkness of night; indeed but the merry
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: play of my sword in the moonlight was often a joy to see, it so
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: flashed, so danced, so sparkled. In the moonlight also one makes no
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: unworthy stroke, but hath scope for those fair passes that Sevastiani
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: taught, which were long ago the wonder of Madrid."
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: The old lord paused, and breathed for a little space, as it were
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: gathering breath for his last words to his son. He breathed
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: deliberately, then spoke again. "I leave you," he said, "well content
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: that you have the two accomplishments, my son, that are most needful in
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: a Christian man, skill with the sword and a way with the mandolin.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: There be other arts indeed among the heathen, for the world is wide and
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: hath full many customs, but these two alone are needful." And then with
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: that grand manner that they had at that time in Spain, although his
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: strength was failing, he gave to his eldest son his Castilian sword. He
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: lay back then in the huge, carved, canopied bed; his eyes closed, the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: red silk curtains rustled, and there was no sound of his breathing. But
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the old lord's spirit, whatever journey it purposed, lingered yet in
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: its ancient habitation, and his voice came again, but feebly now and
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: rambling; he muttered awhile of gardens, such gardens no doubt as the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: hidalgos guarded in that fertile region of sunshine in the proudest
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: period of Spain; he would have known no others. So for awhile his
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: memory seemed to stray, half blind among those perfumed earthly
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: wonders; perhaps among these memories his spirit halted, and tarried
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: those last few moments, mistaking those Spanish gardens, remembered by
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: moonlight in Spring, for the other end of his journey, the glades of
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Paradise. However it be, it tarried. These rambling memories ceased and
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: silence fell again, with scarcely the sound of breathing. Then
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: gathering up his strength for the last time and looking at his son,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "The sword to the wars," he said. "The mandolin to the balconies." With
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: that he fell back dead.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Now there were no wars at that time so far as was known in Spain, but
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: that old lord's eldest son, regarding those last words of his father as
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: a commandment, determined then and there in that dim, vast chamber to
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: gird his legacy to him and seek for the wars, wherever the wars might
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: be, so soon as the obsequies of the sepulture were ended. And of those
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: obsequies I tell not here, for they are fully told in the Black Books
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: of Spain, and the deeds of that old lord's youth are told in the Golden
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Stories. The Book of Maidens mentions him, and again we read of him in
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Gardens of Spain. I take my leave of him, happy, I trust, in Paradise,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: for he had himself the accomplishments that he held needful in a
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Christian, skill with the sword and a way with the mandolin; and if
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: there be some harder, better way to salvation than to follow that which
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: we believe to be good, then are we all damned. So he was buried, and
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: his eldest son fared forth with his legacy dangling from his girdle in
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: its long, straight, lovely scabbard, blue velvet, with emeralds on it,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: fared forth on foot along a road of Spain. And though the road turned
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: left and right and sometimes nearly ceased, as though to let the small
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: wild flowers grow, out of sheer good will such as some roads never
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: have; though it ran west and east and sometimes south, yet in the main
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: it ran northward, though wandered is a better word than ran, and the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Lord of the Valleys of Arguento Harez who owned no valleys, or anything
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: but a sword, kept company with it looking for the wars. Upon his back
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: he had slung his mandolin. Now the time of the year was Spring, not
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Spring as we know it in England, for it was but early March, but it was
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the time when Spring coming up out of Africa, or unknown lands to the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: south, first touches Spain, and multitudes of anemones come forth at
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: her feet.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Thence she comes north to our islands, no less wonderful in our woods
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: than in Andalusian valleys, fresh as a new song, fabulous as a rune,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: but a little pale through travel, so that our flowers do not quite
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: flare forth with all the myriad blaze of the flowers of Spain.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And all the way as he went the young man looked at the flame of those
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: southern flowers, flashing on either side of him all the way, as though
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the rainbow had been broken in Heaven and its fragments fallen on
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Spain. All the way as he went he gazed at those flowers, the first
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: anemones of the year; and long after, whenever he sang to old airs of
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Spain, he thought of Spain as it appeared that day in all the wonder of
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Spring; the memory lent a beauty to his voice and a wistfulness to his
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: eyes that accorded not ill with the theme of the songs he sang, and
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: were more than once to melt proud hearts deemed cold. And so gazing he
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: came to a town that stood on a hill, before he was yet tired, though he
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: had done nigh twenty of those flowery miles of Spain; and since it was
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: evening and the light was fading away, he went to an inn and drew his
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: sword in the twilight and knocked with the hilt of it on the oaken
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: door. The name of it was the Inn of the Dragon and Knight. A light was
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: lit in one of the upper windows, the darkness seemed to deepen at that
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: moment, a step was heard coming heavily down a stairway; and having
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: named the inn to you, gentle reader, it is time for me to name the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: young man also, the landless lord of the Valleys of Arguento Harez, as
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the step comes slowly down the inner stairway, as the gloaming darkens
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: over the first house in which he has ever sought shelter so far from
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: his father's valleys, as he stands upon the threshold of romance. He
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: was named Rodriguez Trinidad Fernandez, Concepcion Henrique Maria; but
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: we shall briefly name him Rodriguez in this story; you and I, reader,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: will know whom we mean; there is no need therefore to give him his full
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: names, unless I do it here and there to remind you.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: The steps came thumping on down the inner stairway, different windows
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: took the light of the candle, and none other shone in the house; it was
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: clear that it was moving with the steps all down that echoing stairway.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: The sound of the steps ceased to reverberate upon the wood, and now
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: they slowly moved over stone flags; Rodriguez now heard breathing, one
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: breath with every step, and at length the sound of bolts and chains
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: When he came to the dining-chamber he found Morano astir. Morano looked
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley

author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Good morning, Morano," said Rodriguez blithely.

author: Dunsany, Lord

author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Good morning," answered the servant of the Dragon and Knight.

author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "I am looking for the wars. Would you like a new master, Morano?"
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Indeed," said Morano, "a good master is better to some men's minds

author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley

author: Dunsany, Lord

author: Dunsany, Lord

author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley

author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley

author: Dunsany, Lord

author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley

author: Dunsany, Lord

author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley

author: Dunsany, Lord

author: Dunsany, Lord

author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley

author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley

author: Dunsany, Lord

author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Once more Rodriguez looked round him over the plain, seeing no houses,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: no men; and his opinion of Morano's judgment sank when he said
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: disguises. But then Morano unfolded to him that plan which up to that
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: day had never been tried before, so far as records tell, in all the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: straits in which fugitive men have been; and which seems from my
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: researches in verse and prose never to have been attempted since.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: The plan was this, astute as Morano, and simple as his naive mind. The
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: clothing for which Rodriguez searched the plain vainly was ready to
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: hand. No disguise was effective against la Garda, they had too many
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: suspicions, their skill was to discover disguises. But in the moment of
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: la Garda's triumph, when they had found out the disguise, when success
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: had lulled the suspicions for which they were infamous, then was the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: time to trick la Garda. Rodriguez wondered; but the slow mind of Morano
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: was sure, and now he came to the point, the fruit of his hour's
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: thinking. Rodriguez should disguise himself as Morano. When la Garda
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: discovered that he was not the man he appeared to be, a study to which
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: they devoted their lives, their suspicions would rest and there would
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: be an end of it. And Morano should disguise himself as Rodriguez.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: It was a new idea. Had Rodriguez been twice his age he would have
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: discarded it at once; for age is guided by precedent which, when
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: pursued, is a dangerous guide indeed. Even as it was he was critical,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: for the novelty of the thing coming thus from his gross servant
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: surprised him as much as though Morano had uttered poetry of his own
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: when he sang, as he sometimes did, certain merry lascivious songs of
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Spain that any one of the last few centuries knew as well as any of the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: others.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And would not la Garda find out that he was himself, Rodriguez asked,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: as quickly as they found out he was not Morano.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "That," said Morano, "is not the way of la Garda. For once let la Garda
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: come by a suspicion, such as that you, master, are but Morano, and they
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: will cling to it even to the last, and not abandon it until they needs
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: must, and then throw it away as it were in disgust and ride hence at
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: once, for they like not tarrying long near one who has seen them
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: mistaken."
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "They will soon then come by another suspicion," said Rodriguez.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Not so, master," answered Morano, "for those that are as suspicious as
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: la Garda change their suspicions but slowly. A suspicion is an old song
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: to them."
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Then," said Rodriguez, "I shall be hard set ever to show that I am not
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: you if they ever suspect I am."
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "It will be hard, master," Morano answered; "but we shall do it, for we
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: shall have truth upon our side."
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "How shall we disguise ourselves?" said Rodriguez.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Master," said Morano, "when you came to our town none knew you and all
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: marked your clothes. As for me my fat body is better known than my
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: clothes, yet am I not too well known by la Garda, for, being an honest
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: man, whenever la Garda came I used to hide."
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "You did well," said Rodriguez.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Certainly I did well," said Morano, "for had they seen me they might,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: on account of certain matters, have taken me to prison, and prison is
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: no place for an honest man."
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Let us disguise ourselves," said Rodriguez.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Master," answered Morano, "the brain is greater than the stomach, and
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: now more than at any time we need the counsel of the brain; let us
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: therefore appease the clamours of the stomach that it be silent."
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And he drew out from amongst his clothing a piece of sacking in which
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: was a mass of bacon and some lard, and unslung his huge frying-pan.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Rodriguez had entirely forgotten the need of food, but now the memory
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: of it had rushed upon him like a flood over a barrier, as soon as he
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: saw the bacon. And when they had collected enough of tiny inflammable
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: things, for it was a treeless plain, and Morano had made a fire, and
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the odour of the bacon became perceptible, this memory was hugely
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: intensified.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Let us eat while they eat, master," said Morano, "and plan while they
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: sleep, and disguise ourselves while they pursue."
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And this they did: for after they had eaten they dug up earth and
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: gathered leaves with which to fill the gaps in Morano's garments when
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: they should hang on Rodriguez, they plucked a geranium with whose dye
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: they deepened Rodriguez' complexion, and with the sap from the stalk of
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: a weed Morano toned to a pallor the ruddy brown of his tough cheeks.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Then they changed clothes altogether, which made Morano gasp: and after
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: that nothing remained but to cut off the delicate black moustachios of
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Rodriguez and to stick them to the face of Morano with the juice of
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: another flower that he knew where to find. Rodriguez sighed when he saw
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: them go. He had pictured ecstatic glances cast some day at those
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: moustachios, glances from under long eyelashes twinkling at evening
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: from balconies; and looking at them where they were now, he felt that
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: this was impossible.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: For one moment Morano raised his head with an air, as it were preening
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: himself, when the new moustachios had stuck; but as soon as he saw, or
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: felt, his master's sorrow at their loss he immediately hung his head,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: showing nothing but shame for the loss he had caused his master, or for
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the impropriety of those delicate growths that so ill become his jowl.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And now they took the road again, Rodriguez with the great frying-pan
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: and cooking-pot; no longer together, but not too far apart for la Garda
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: to take them both at once, and to make the doubly false charge that
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: should so confound their errand. And Morano wore that old triumphant
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: sword, and carried the mandolin that was ever young.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: They had not gone far when it was as Morano had said; for, looking
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: back, as they often did, to the spot where their road touched the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: sky-line, they saw la Garda spurring, seven of them in their
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: unmistakable looped hats, very clear against the sky which a moment ago
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: seemed so fair.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: When the seven saw the two they did not spare the dust; and first they
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: came to Morano.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "You," they said, "are Rodriguez Trinidad Fernandez, Concepcion
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Henrique Maria, a Lord of the Valleys of Arguento Harez."
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "No, masters," said Morano.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Oh but denials were lost upon la Garda.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Denials inflamed their suspicions as no other evidence could. Many a
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: man had they seen with his throat in the hands of the public garrotter;
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: and all had begun with denials who ended thus. They looked at the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: mandolin, at the gay cloak, at the emeralds in the scabbard, for
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: wherever emeralds go there is evidence to identify them, until the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: nature of man changes or the price of emeralds. They spoke hastily
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: among themselves.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Without doubt," said one of them, "you are whom we said." And they
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: arrested Morano.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Then they spurred on to Rodriguez. "You are," they said, "as no man
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: doubts, one Morano, servant at the Inn of the Dragon and Knight, whose
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: good master is, as we allege, dead."
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Masters," answered Rodriguez, "I am but a poor traveller, and no
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: servant at any inn."
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Now la Garda, as I have indicated, will hear all things except denials;
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: and thus to receive two within the space of two moments infuriated them
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: so fiercely that they were incapable of forming any other theory that
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: day except the one they held.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: There are many men like this; they can form a plausible theory and
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: grasp its logical points, but take it away from them and destroy it
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: utterly before their eyes, and they will not so easily lash their tired
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: brains at once to build another theory in place of the one that is
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: ruined.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "As the saints live," they said, "you are Morano." And they arrested
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Rodriguez too.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Now when they began to turn back by the way they had come Rodriguez
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: began to fear overmuch identification, so he assured la Garda that in
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the next village ahead of them were those who would answer all
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: questions concerning him, as well as being the possessors of the finest
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: vintage of wine in the kingdom of Spain.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Now it may be that the mention of this wine soothed the anger caused in
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the men of la Garda by two denials, or it may be that curiosity guided
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: them, at any rate they took the road that led away from last night's
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: sinister shelter, Rodriguez and five of la Garda. Two of them stayed
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: behind with Morano, undecided as yet which way to take, though looking
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: wistfully the way that that wine was said to be; and Rodriguez left
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Morano to his own devices, in which he trusted profoundly.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Now Rodriguez knew not the name of the next village that they would
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: come to nor the names of any of the dwellers in it.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Yet he had a plan. As he went by the side of one of the horses he
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: questioned the rider.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Can Morano write?" he said. La Garda laughed.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Can Morano talk Latin?" he said. La Garda crossed themselves, all five
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: men. And after some while of riding, and hard walking for Rodriguez, to
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: whom they allowed a hand on a stirrup leather, there came in sight the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: tops of the brown roofs of a village over a fold of the plain. "Is this
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: your village?" said one of his captors.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Surely," answered Rodriguez.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "What is its name?" said one.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "It has many names," said Rodriguez.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And then another one of them recognised it from the shape of its roofs.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "It is Saint Judas-not-Iscariot," he said.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Aye, so strangers call it," said Rodriguez.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And where the road turned round that fold of the plain, lolling a
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: little to its left in the idle Spanish air, they came upon the village
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: all in view. I do not know how to describe this village to you, my
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: reader, for the words that mean to you what it was are all the wrong
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: words to use. "Antique," "old-world," "quaint," seem words with which
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: to tell of it. Yet it had no antiquity denied to the other villages; it
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: had been brought to birth like them by the passing of time, and was
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: nursed like them in the lap of plains or valleys of Spain. Nor was it
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: quainter than any of its neighbours, though it was like itself alone,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: as they had their characters also; and, though no village in the world
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: was like it, it differed only from the next as sister differs from
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: world of man.

author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Most of its tall white houses with green doors were gathered about the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: market-place, in which were pigeons and smells and declining sunlight,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: as Rodriguez and his escort came towards it, and from round a corner at
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the back of it the short, repeated song of one who would sell a
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: commodity went up piercingly.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: This was all very long ago. Time has wrecked that village now.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Centuries have flowed over it, some stormily, some smoothly, but so
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: many that, of the village Rodriguez saw, there can be now no more than
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: like youth.

author: Dunsany, Lord

author: Dunsany, Lord

author: Dunsany, Lord

author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: and came to the green door. They pulled a bell whose handle was a
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: symbol carved in copper, one of the Priest's mysteries. The bell boomed
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: through the house, a tiny musical boom, and the Priest opened the door;
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: and Rodriguez addressed him in Latin. And the Priest answered him.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: At first la Garda had not realised what had happened. And then the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Priest beckoned and they all entered his house, for Rodriguez had asked
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: him for ink. Into a room they came where a silver ink-pot was, and the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: grey plume of the goose. Picture no such ink-pot, my reader, as they
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: sell to-day in shops, the silver no thicker than paper, and perhaps a
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: pattern all over it guaranteed artistic. It was molten silver well
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: wrought, and hollowed for ink. And in the hollow there was the magical
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: fluid, the stuff that rules the world and hinders time; that in which
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: flows the will of a king, to establish his laws for ever; that which
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: gives valleys unto new possessors; that whereby towers are held by
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: their lawful owners; that which, used grimly by the King's judge, is
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: death; that which, when poets play, is mirth for ever and ever.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: No wonder la Garda looked at it in awe, no wonder they crossed
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: themselves again: and then Rodriguez wrote. In the silence that
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: followed the jaws of la Garda dropped, while the old Priest slightly
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: smiled, for he somewhat divined the situation already; and, being the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: people's friend, he loved not la Garda more than he was bound by the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: rules of his duty to man.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Then one of la Garda spoke, bringing back his confidence with a
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: bluster. "Morano has sold his soul to Satan," he said, "in exchange for
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Satan's aid, and Satan has taught his tongue Latin and guides his
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: fingers in the affairs of the pen." And so said all la Garda, rejoicing
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: at finding an explanation where a moment ago there was none, as all men
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: at such times do: little it matters what the explanation be: does a man
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: in Sahara, who finds water suddenly, inquire with precision what its
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: qualities are?
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And then the Priest said a word and made a sign, against which Satan
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: himself can only prevail with difficulty, and in presence of which his
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: spells can never endure. And after this Rodriguez wrote again. Then
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: were la Garda silent.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And at length the leader said, and he called on them all to testify,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: that he had made no charge whatever against this traveller; moreover,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: they had escorted him on his way out of respect for him, because the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: roads were dangerous, and must now depart because they had higher
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: duties. So la Garda departed, looking before them with stern,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: preoccupied faces and urging their horses on, as men who go on an
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: errand of great urgency. And Rodriguez, having thanked them for their
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: protection upon the road, turned back into the house and the two sat
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: down together, and Rodriguez told his rescuer the story of the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: hospitality of the Inn of the Dragon and Knight.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Not as confession he told it, but as a pleasant tale, for he looked on
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the swift demise of la Garda's friend, in the night, in the spidery
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: room, as a fair blessing for Spain, a thing most suited to the sweet
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: days of Spring. The spiritual man rejoiced to hear such a tale, as do
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: all men of peace to hear talk of violent deeds in which they may not
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: share. And when the tale was ended he reproved Rodriguez exceedingly,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: explaining to him the nature of the sin of blood, and telling him that
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: absolution could be come by now, though hardly, but how on some future
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: occasion there might be none to be had. And Rodriguez listened with all
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the gravity of expression that youth knows well how to wear while its
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: thoughts are nimbly dancing far away in fair fields of adventure or
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: love.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And darkness came down and lamps were carried in: and the reverend
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: father asked Rodriguez in what other affairs of violence his sword had
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: unhappily been. And Rodriguez knew well the history of that sword,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: having gathered all that concerned it out of spoken legend or song. And
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: although the reverend man frowned minatorily whenever he heard of its
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: passings through the ribs of the faithful, and nodded as though his
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: head gave benediction when he heard of the destruction of God's most
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: vile enemy the infidel, and though he gasped a little through his lips
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: when he heard of certain tarryings of that sword, in scented gardens,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: while Christian knights should sleep and their swords hang on the wall,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: though sometimes even a little he raised his hands, yet he leaned
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: forward always, listening well, and picturing clearly as though his
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: gleaming eyes could see them, each doleful tale of violence or sin. And
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: so night came, and began to wear away, and neither knew how late the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: hour was. And then as Rodriguez spoke of an evening in a garden, of
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: which some old song told well, a night in early summer under the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: evening star, and that sword there as always; as he told of his
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: grandfather as poets had loved to tell, going among the scents of the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: huge flowers, familiar with the dark garden as the moths that drifted
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: by him; as he spoke of a sigh heard faintly, as he spoke of danger
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: near, whether to body or soul; as the reverend father was about to
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: raise both his hands; there came a thunder of knockings upon the locked
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: green door.

author: Dunsany, Lord

author: Dunsany, Lord

author: Dunsany, Lord
