text: THE THIRD CHRONICLE
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: HOW HE CAME TO THE HOUSE OF WONDER
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: It was the gross Morano. Here he had tracked Rodriguez, for where la
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Garda goes is always known, and rumour of it remains long behind them,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: like the scent of a fox. He told no tale of his escape more than a dog
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: does who comes home some hours late; a dog comes back to his master,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: that is all, panting a little perhaps; someone perhaps had caught him
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: and he escaped and came home, a thing too natural to attempt to speak
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: of by any of the signs that a dog knows.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Part of Morano's method seems to have resembled Rodriguez', for just as
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Rodriguez spoke Latin, so Morano fell back upon his own natural speech,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: that he as it were unbridled and allowed to run free, the coarseness of
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: which had at first astounded, and then delighted, la Garda.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "And did they not suspect that you were yourself?" said Rodriguez.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "No, master," Morano answered, "for I said that I was the brother of
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the King of Aragon."
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "The King of Aragon!" Rodriguez said, going to the length of showing
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: surprise. "Yes, indeed, master." said Morano, "and they recognised me."
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Recognised you!" exclaimed the Priest.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Indeed so," said Morano, "for they said that they were themselves the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Kings of Aragon; and so, father, they recognised me for their brother."
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "That you should not have said," the Priest told Morano.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Reverend father," replied Morano, "as Heaven shines, I believed that
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: what I said was true." And Morano sighed deeply. "And now," he said, "I
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: know it is true no more."
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Whether he sighed for the loss of his belief in that exalted
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: relationship, or whether for the loss of that state of mind in which
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: such beliefs come easily, there was nothing in his sigh to show. They
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: questioned him further, but he said no more: he was here, there was no
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: more to say: he was here and la Garda was gone.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And then the reverend man brought for them a great supper, even at that
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: late hour, for many an hour had slipped softly by as he heard the sins
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: of the sword; and wine he set out, too, of a certain golden vintage,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: long lost--I fear--my reader: but this he gave not to Morano lest he
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: should be once more, what the reverend father feared to entertain, that
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: dread hidalgo, the King of Aragon's brother. And after that, the stars
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: having then gone far on their ways, the old Priest rose and offered a
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: bed to Rodriguez; and even as he eyed Morano, wondering where to put
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: him, and was about to speak, for he had no other bed, Morano went to a
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: corner of the room and curled up and lay down. And by the time his host
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: had walked over to him and spoken, asking anxiously if he needed
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: nothing more, he was almost already asleep, and muttered in answer,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: after having been spoken to twice, no more than "Straw, reverend
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: father, straw."
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: An armful of this the good man brought him, and then showed Rodriguez
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: to his room; and they can scarcely have reached it before Morano was
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: back in Aragon again, walking on golden shoes (which were sometimes
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: wings), proud among lesser princes.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: As precaution for the night Rodriguez took one more glance at his
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: host's kind face; and then, with sword out of reach and an unlocked
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: door, he slept till the songs of birds out of the deeps of the ilices
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: made sleep any longer impossible.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: The third morning of Rodriguez' wandering blazed over Spain like brass;
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: flowers and grass and sky were twinkling all together.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: When Rodriguez greeted his host Morano was long astir, having awakened
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: with dawn, for the simpler and humbler the creature the nearer it is
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: akin to the earth and the sun. The forces that woke the birds and
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: opened the flowers stirred the gross lump of Morano, ending his sleep
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: as they ended the nightingale's song.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: They breakfasted hurriedly and Rodriguez rose to depart, feeling that
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: he had taken hospitality that had not been offered. But against his
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: departure was the barrier of all the politeness of Spain. The house was
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: his, said his host, and even the small grove of ilices.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: If I told you half of the things that the reverend man said, you would
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: say: "This writer is affected. I do not like all this flowery mush." I
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: think it safer, my reader, not to tell you any of it. Let us suppose
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: that he merely said, "Quite all right," and that when Rodriguez thanked
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: him on one knee he answered, "Not at all;" and that so Rodriguez and
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Morano left. If here it miss some flash of the fair form of Truth it is
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the fault of the age I write for.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: The road again, dust again, birds and the blaze of leaves, these were
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the background of my wanderers, until the eye had gone as far as the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: eye can roam, and there were the tips of some far pale-blue mountains
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: that now came into view.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: They were still in each other's clothes; but the village was not behind
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: them very far when Morano explained, for he knew the ways of la Garda,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: that having arrested two men upon this road, they would now arrest two
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: men each on all the other roads, in order to show the impartiality of
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the Law, which constantly needs to be exhibited; and that therefore all
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: men were safe on the road they were on for a long while to come.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Now there seemed to Rodriguez to be much good sense in what Morano had
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: said; and so indeed there was for they had good laws in Spain, and they
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: differed little, though so long ago, from our own excellent system.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Therefore they changed once more, giving back to each other everything
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: but, alas, those delicate black moustachios; and these to Rodriguez
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: seemed gone for ever, for the growth of new ones seemed so far ahead to
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the long days of youth that his hopes could scarce reach to them.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: When Morano found himself once more in those clothes that had been with
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: him night and day for so many years he seemed to expand; I mean no
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: metaphor here; he grew visibly fatter.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Ah," said Morano after a huge breath, "last night I dreamed, in your
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: illustrious clothes, that I was in lofty station. And now, master, I am
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: comfortable."
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Which were best, think you," said Rodriguez, "if you could have but
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: one, a lofty place or comfort?" Even in those days such a question was
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: trite, but Rodriguez uttered it only thinking to dip in the store of
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Morano's simple wisdom, as one may throw a mere worm to catch a worthy
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: fish. But in this he was disappointed; for Morano made no neat
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: comparison nor even gave an opinion, saying only, "Master, while I have
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: comfort how shall I judge the case of any who have not?" And no more
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: would he say. His new found comfort, lost for a day and night, seemed
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: so to have soothed his body that it closed the gates of the mind, as
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: too much luxury may, even with poets.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And now Rodriguez thought of his quest again, and the two of them
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: pushed on briskly to find the wars.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: For an hour they walked in silence an empty road. And then they came
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: upon a row of donkeys; piled high with the bark of the cork-tree, that
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the windows, till they saw large shadows obscurely passing from room to
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley

text: room. The ascent was steep now and the pathway stopped. No track of any
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: kind approached the house. It stood on a precipice-edge as though one
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: of the rocks of the mountain: they climbed over rocks to reach it. The
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: windows flickered and blinked at them.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

author: Dunsany, Lord

author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

author: Dunsany, Lord

author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

author: Dunsany, Lord

author: Dunsany, Lord

author: Dunsany, Lord

author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley

author: Dunsany, Lord

author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley

author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

author: Dunsany, Lord

author: Dunsany, Lord

author: Dunsany, Lord

author: Dunsany, Lord

author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Ah, Senores," the old man sighed, "the Professor does not allow me to
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: be young. I have been here years and years but he never allowed it. I
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley

author: Dunsany, Lord

author: Dunsany, Lord

author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley

author: Dunsany, Lord

author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley

text: "Who is this professor?" he said.

author: Dunsany, Lord

author: Dunsany, Lord

text: wondering, wistful eyes. The old man halted and turned half round, and
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley

author: Dunsany, Lord

author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "At Saragossa," the old man affirmed.

author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Between that ancient citadel of learning and this most savage mountain
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley

author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley

author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the moon and peering rockets. He turned from the window and wept.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: The deep round window glowed with serene blue glory. It seemed a
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: foolish thing to weep by that beautiful glass. Morano tried to comfort
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: him. That calm, deep blue, he felt, and those little lights, surely,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: could hurt no one.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: What had Rodriguez seen? Morano asked. But that Rodriguez would not
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: answer, and told no man ever after what he had seen through that window.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: The Professor stood silent still: he had no comfort to offer; indeed
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: his magical wisdom had found none for the world.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: You wonder perhaps why the Professor did not give long ago to the world
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: some of these marvels that are the pride of our age. Reader, let us put
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: aside my tale for a moment to answer this. For all the darkness of his
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: sinister art there may well have been some good in the Slave of Orion;
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: and any good there was, and mere particle even, would surely have
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: spared the world many of those inventions that our age has not spared
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: it. Blame not the age, it is now too late to stop; it is in the grip of
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: inventions now, and has to go on; we cannot stop content with
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: mustard-gas; it is the age of Progress, and our motto is Onwards. And
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: if there was no good in this magical man, then may it not have been he
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: who in due course, long after he himself was safe from life, caused our
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: inventions to be so deadly divulged? Some evil spirit has done it, then
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: why not he?
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: He stood there silent: let us return to our story.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Perhaps the efforts of poor clumsy Morano to comfort him cheered
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Rodriguez and sent him back to the window, perhaps he turned from them
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: to find comfort of his own; but, however he came by it, he had a hope
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: that this was a passing curse that had come on the world, whose welfare
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: he cared for whether he lived or died, and that looking a little
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: farther into the future he would see Mother Earth smiling and her
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: children happy again. So he looked through the deep-blue luminous
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: window once more, beyond the battles we know. From this he turned back
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: shuddering.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: own weakness, or whether with cynical mirth at the fate of the world,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Rodriguez could not say.

text: HOW HE CAME TO THE MOUNTAINS OF THE SUN
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: The Professor said that in curiosity alone had been found the seeds of
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: all that is needful for our damnation. Nevertheless, he said, if
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Rodriguez cared to see more of his mighty art the mysteries of
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Saragossa were all at his guest's disposal.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Rodriguez, sad and horrified though he was, forgot none of his
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: courtesy. He thanked the Professor and praised the art of Saragossa,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: but his faith in man and his hope for the world having been newly
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: disappointed, he cared little enough for the things we should care to
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: see or for any of the amusements that are usually dear to youth.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "I shall be happy to see anything, senor," he said to the Slave of
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Orion, "that is further from our poor Earth, and to study therein and
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: admire your famous art."
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: The Professor bowed. He drew small curtains over the windows, matching
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: his cloak. Morano sought a glimpse through the right-hand window before
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the curtains covered it. Rodriguez held him back. Enough had been seen
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: already, he thought, through that window for the peace of mind of the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: world: but he said no word to Morano. He held him by the arm, and the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Professor covered the windows. When the little mauve curtains were
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: drawn it seemed to Rodriguez that the windows behind them disappeared
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: and were there no more; but this he only guessed from uncertain
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: indications.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Then the Professor drew forth his wand and went to his cupboard of
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: wonder. Thence he brought condiments, oils, and dews of amazement.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: These he poured into a vessel that was in the midst of the room, a bowl
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: of agate standing alone on a table. He lit it and it all welled up in
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: flame, a low broad flame of the colour of pale emerald. Over this he
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: waved his wand, which was of exceeding blackness. Morano watched as
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: children watch the dancer, who goes from village to village when spring
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: is come, with some new dance out of Asia or some new song.[Footnote: He
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: doesn't, but why shouldn't he?] Rodriguez sat and waited. The Professor
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: explained that to leave this Earth alive, or even dead, was prohibited
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: to our bodies, unless to a very few, whose names were hidden. Yet the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: spirits of men could by incantation be liberated, and being liberated,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: could be directed on journeys by such minds as had that power passed
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: down to them from of old. Such journeys, he said, were by no means
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: confined by the hills of Earth. "The Saints," exclaimed Morano, "guard
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: us utterly!" But Rodriguez smiled a little. His faith was given to the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Saints of Heaven. He wondered at their wonders, he admired their
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: miracles, he had little faith to spare for other marvels; in fact he
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: did not believe the Slave of Orion.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Do you desire such a journey?" said the Professor.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "It will delight me," answered Rodriguez, "to see this example of your
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: art."
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "And you?" he said to Morano.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: The question seemed to alarm the placid Morano, but "I follow my
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: master," he said.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: At once the Professor stretched out his ebony wand, calling the green
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: flame higher. Then he put out his hands over the flame, without the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: wand, moving them slowly with constantly tremulous fingers. And all at
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: once they heard him begin to speak. His deep voice flowed musically
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: while he scarcely seemed to be speaking but seemed only to be concerned
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: with moving his hands. It came soft, as though blown faint from
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: fabulous valleys, illimitably far from the land of Spain. It seemed
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: full not so much of magic as mere sleep, either sleep in an unknown
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: country of alien men, or sleep in a land dreamed sleeping a long while
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: since. As the travellers heard it they thought of things far away, of
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: mythical journeys and their own earliest years.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: They did not know what he said or what language he used. At first
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Rodriguez thought Moorish, then he deemed it some secret language come
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: down from magicians of old, while Morano merely wondered; and then they
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: were lulled by the rhythm of those strange words, and so enquired no
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: more. Rodriguez pictured some sad wandering angel, upon some
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: mountain-peak of African lands, resting a moment and talking to the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: solitudes, telling the lonely valley the mysteries of his home. While
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: lulled though Morano was he gave up his alertness uneasily. All the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: while the green flame flooded upwards: all the while the tremulous
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: fingers made curious shadows. The shadow seemed to run to Rodriguez and
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: beckon him thence: even Morano felt them calling. Rodriguez closed his
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: eyes. The voice and the Moorish spells made now a more haunting melody:
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: they were now like a golden organ on undiscoverable mountains. Fear
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: came on Morano at the thought: who had power to speak like this? He
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: grasped Rodriguez by the wrist. "Master!" he said, but at that moment
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: on one of those golden spells the spirit of Rodriguez drifted away from
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: his body, and out of the greenish light of the curious room; unhampered
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: by weight, or fatigue, or pain, or sleep; and it rose above the rocks
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: and over the mountain, an unencumbered spirit: and the spirit of Morano
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: followed.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: The mountain dwindled at once; the Earth swept out all round them and
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: grew larger, and larger still, and then began to dwindle. They saw then
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: that they were launched upon some astounding journey. Does my reader
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: wonder they saw when they had no eyes? They saw as they had never seen
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: before, with sight beyond what they had ever thought to be possible.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Our eyes gather in light, and with the little rays of light that they
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: bring us we gather a few images of things as we suppose them to be.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Pardon me, reader, if I call them things as we suppose them to be; call
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: them by all means Things As They Really Are, if you wish. These images
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: then, this tiny little brainful that we gather from the immensities,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: are all brought in by our eyesight upside-down, and the brain corrects
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: them again; and so, and so we know something. An oculist will tell you
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: how it all works. He may admit it is all a little clumsy, or for the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: dignity of his profession he may say it is not at all. But be this as
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: it may, our eyes are but barriers between us and the immensities. All
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: our five senses that grope a little here and touch a little there, and
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: seize, and compare notes, and get a little knowledge sometimes, they
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: are only barriers between us and what there is to know. Rodriguez and
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Morano were outside these barriers. They saw without the imperfections
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: of eyesight; they heard on that journey what would have deafened ears;
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: they went through our atmosphere unburned by speed, and were unchilled
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: in the bleak of the outer spaces. Thus freed of the imperfections of
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the body they sped, no less upon a terrible journey, whose direction as
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: yet Rodriguez only began to fear.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: They had seen the stars pale rapidly and then the flash of dawn. The
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Sun rushed up and at once began to grow larger. Earth, with her curved
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: sides still diminishing violently, was soon a small round garden in
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: blue and filmy space, in which mountains were planted. And still the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Sun was growing wider and wider. And now Rodriguez, though he knew
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: nothing of Sun or planets, perceived the obvious truth of their
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: terrible journey: they were heading straight for the Sun. But the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: spirit of Morano was merely astounded; yet, being free of the body he
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: suffered none of those inconveniences that perturbation may bring to
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: us: spirits do not gasp, or palpitate, or weaken, or sicken.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: The dwindling Earth seemed now no more than the size of some unmapped
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: island seen from a mountain-top, an island a hundred yards or so
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: across, looking like a big table.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Speed is comparative: compared to sound, their pace was beyond
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: comparison; nor could any modern projectile attain any velocity
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: comparable to it; even the speed of explosion was slow to it. And yet
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: for spirits they were moving slowly, who being independent of all
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: material things, travel with such velocities as that, for instance, of
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: thought. But they were controlled by one still dwelling on Earth, who
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: used material things, and the material that the Professor was using to
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: hurl them upon their journey was light, the adaptation of which to this
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: purpose he had learned at Saragossa. At the pace of light they were
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: travelling towards the Sun.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: They crossed the path of Venus, far from where Venus then was, so that
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: she scarcely seemed larger to them; Earth was but little bigger than
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the Evening Star, looking dim in that monstrous daylight.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Crossing the path of Mercury, Mercury appeared huger than our Moon, an
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: object weirdly unnatural; and they saw ahead of them the terrific glare
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: in which Mercury basks, from a Sun whose withering orb had more than
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: doubled its width since they came from the hills of Earth. And after
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: this the Sun grew terribly larger, filling the centre of the sky, and
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: spreading and spreading and spreading. It was now that they saw what
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: would have dazzled eyes, would have burned up flesh and would have
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: shrivelled every protection that our scientists' ingenuity could have
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: devised even today. To speak of time there is meaningless. There is
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: is at all concerned. Far less is there meaning in time wherever the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: spirits of men are under stress. A few minutes' bombardment in a
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: trench, a few hours in a battle, a few weeks' travelling in a trackless
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: country; these minutes, these hours, these weeks can never be few.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Rodriguez and Morano had been travelling about six or seven minutes,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: but it seems idle to say so.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: another minute, if minutes had any meaning, they were heading for a
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: boundless region of flame that, left and right, was everywhere, and now
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: towered above them, and went below them into a flaming abyss.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Rodriguez was aware of his thinking: it is thus that spirits
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: communicate.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley

text: was thin and young, twenty years gone at least; and the butterflies

text: were come, and song was everywhere; there came a maid bare-footed over

author: Dunsany, Lord

text: a stream, walking through flowers, and all to pluck the anemones." How
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: fair she seemed even now, how bright that far spring day. Morano told
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Rodriguez not with his blundering lips: they were closed and resting
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: deeply millions of miles away: he told him as spirits tell. And in that
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: clear communication Rodriguez saw all that shone in Morano's memory,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the grace of the young girl's ankles, the thrill of Spring, the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: anemones larger and brighter than anemones ever were, the hawks still
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: in clear sky; earth happy and heaven blue, and the dreams of youth
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: between. You would not have said, had you seen Morano's coarse fat
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: body, asleep in a chair in the Professor's room, that his spirit
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: treasured such delicate, nymph-like, pastoral memories as now shone
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: clear to Rodriguez. No words the blunt man had ever been able to utter
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: had ever hinted that he sometimes thought like a dream of pictures by
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Watteau. And now in that awful space before the power of the terrible
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Sun, spirit communed with spirit, and Rodriguez saw the beauty of that
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: far day, framed all about the beauty of one young girl, just as it had
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: been for years in Morano's memory. How shall I tell with words what
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: spirit sang wordless to spirit? We poets may compete with each other in
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: words; but when spirits give up the purest gold of their store, that
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: has shone far down the road of their earthly journey, cheering tired
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: hearts and guiding mortal feet, our words shall barely interpret.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Love, coming long ago over flowers in Spain, found Morano; words did
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: not tell the story, words cannot tell it; as a lake reflects a cloud in
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the blue of heaven, so Rodriguez understood and felt and knew this
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: memory out of the days of Morano's youth. "And so, master," said
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Morano, "I sinned, and would indeed repent, and yet even now at this
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: last dread hour I cannot abjure that day; and this is indeed Hell, as
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the good father said."
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Rodriguez tried to comfort Morano with such knowledge as he had of
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: astronomy, if knowledge it could be called. Indeed, if he had known
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: anything he would have perplexed Morano more, and his little pieces of
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: ignorance were well adapted for comfort. But Morano had given up hope,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: having long been taught to expect this very fire: his spirit was no
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: wiser than it had been on Earth, it was merely freed of the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: imperfections of the five senses and so had observation and expression
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: beyond those of any artist the world has known. This was the natural
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: result of being freed of the body; but he was not suddenly wiser; and
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: so, as he moved towards this boundless flame, he expected every moment
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: to see Satan charge out to meet him: and having no hope for the future
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: he turned to the past and fondled the memory of that one spring day.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: His was a backsliding, unrepentant spirit.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: As that monstrous sea of flame grew ruthlessly larger Rodriguez felt no
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: fear, for spirits have no fear of material things: but Morano feared.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: He feared as spirits fear spiritual things; he thought he neared the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: home of vast spirits of evil and that the arena of conflict was
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: eternity. He feared with a fear too great to be borne by bodies.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Perhaps the fat body that slept on a chair on earth was troubled in
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: dreams by some echo of that fear that gripped the spirit so sorely. And
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: it may be from such far fears that all our nightmares come.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: When they had travelled nearly ten minutes from Earth and were about to
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: pass into the midst of the flame, that magician who controlled their
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: journey halted them suddenly in Space, among the upper mountain-peaks
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: of the Sun. There they hovered as the clouds hover that leave their
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: companions and drift among crags of the Alps: below them those awful
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: mountains heaved and thundered. All Atlas, and Teneriffe, and lonely
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Kenia might have lain amongst them unnoticed. As often as the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: earthquake rocked their bases it loosened from near their summits wild
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: avalanches of gold that swept down their flaming slopes with
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: unthinkable tumult. As they watched, new mountains rode past them,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: crowned with their frightful flames; for, whether man knew it or not,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the Sun was rotating, but the force of its gravity that swung the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: planets had no grip upon spirits, who were held by the power of that
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: tremendous spell that the Professor had learned one midnight at
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Saragossa from one of that dread line who have their secrets from a
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: source that we do not know in a distant age.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: There is always something tremendous in the form of great mountains;
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: but these swept by, not only huger than anything Earth knows, but
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: troubled by horrible commotions, as though overtaken in flight by some
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: ceaseless calamity.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Rodriguez and Morano, as they looked at them, forgetting the gardens of
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Earth, forgetting Spring and Summer and the sweet beneficence of
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: sunshine, felt that the purpose of Creation was evil! So shocking a
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: thought may well astound us here, where green hills slope to lawns or
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: peer at a peaceful sea; but there among the flames of those dreadful
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: peaks the Sun seemed not the giver of joy and colour and life, but only
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: a catastrophe huger than everlasting war, a centre of hideous violence
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: and ruin and anger and terror. There came by mountains of copper
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: burning everlasting, hurling up to unthinkable heights their mass of
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: emerald flame. And mountains of iron raged by and mountains of salt,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: quaking and thundering and clothed with their colours, the iron always
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: scarlet and the salt blue. And sometimes there came by pinnacles a
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: thousand miles high that from base to summit were fire, mountains of
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: pure flame that had no other substance. And these explosive mountains,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: born of thunder and earthquake, hurling down avalanches the size of our
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: continents, and drawing upward out of the deeps of the Sun new material
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: for splendour and horror, this roaring waste, this extravagant
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: destruction, were necessary for every tint that our butterflies wear on
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: their wings. Without those flaming ranges of mountains of iron they
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: would have no red to show; even the poppy could have no red for her
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: petals: without the flames that were blasting the mountains of salt
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: there could be no answering blue in any wing, or one blue flower for
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: all the bees of Earth: without the nightmare light of those frightful
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: canyons of copper that awed the two spirits watching their ceaseless
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: ruin, the very leaves of the woods we love would be without their green
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: with which to welcome Spring; for from the flames of the various metals
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: and wonders that for ever blaze in the Sun, our sunshine gets all its
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: colours that it conveys to us almost unseen, and thence the wise little
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: insects and patient flowers softly draw the gay tints that they glory
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: in; there is nowhere else to get them.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And yet to Rodriguez and Morano all that they saw seemed wholly and
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: hideously evil.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: How long they may have watched there they tried to guess afterwards,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: but as they looked on those terrific scenes they had no way to separate
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: days from minutes: nothing about them seemed to escape destruction, and
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: time itself seemed no calmer than were those shuddering mountains.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Then the thundering ranges passed; and afterwards there came a gleaming
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: mountain, one huge and lonely peak, seemingly all of gold. Had our
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: whole world been set beside it and shaped as it was shaped, that golden
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: mountain would yet have towered above it: it would have taken our moon
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: as well to reach that flashing peak. It rode on toward them in its
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: golden majesty, higher than all the flames, save now and then when some
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: wild gas seemed to flee from the dread earthquakes of the Sun, and was
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: overtaken in the height by fire, even above that mountain.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: As that mass of gold that was higher than all the world drew near to
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Rodriguez and Morano they felt its unearthly menace; and though it
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: could not overcome their spirits they knew there was a hideous terror
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: about it. It was in its awful scale that its terror lurked for any
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: creature of our planet. Though they could not quake or tremble they
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: felt that terror. The mountain dwarfed Earth.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Man knows his littleness, his own mountains remind him; many countries
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: are small, and some nations: but the dreams of Man make up for our
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: faults and failings, for the brevity of our lives, for the narrowness
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: of our scope; they leap over boundaries and are away and away. But this
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: great mountain belittled the world and all: who gazed on it knew all
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: his dreams to be puny. Before this mountain Man seemed a trivial thing,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: and Earth, and all the dreams Man had of himself and his home.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: The golden mass drew opposite those two watchers and seemed to
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: challenge with its towering head the pettiness of the tiny world they
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: knew. And then the whole gleaming mountain gave one shudder and fell
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: into the awful plains of the Sun. Straight down before Rodriguez and
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Morano it slipped roaring, till the golden peak was gone, and the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: molten plain closed over it; and only ripples remained, the size of
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Europe, as when a tumbling river strikes the rocks of its bed and on
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: its surface heaving circles widen and disappear. And then, as though
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: this horror left nothing more to be shown, they felt the Professor
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: beckon to them from Earth.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Over the plains of the Sun a storm was sweeping in gusts of howling
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: flame as they felt the Professor's spell drawing them home. For the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: magnitude of that storm there are no words in use among us; its
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: velocity, if expressed in figures, would have no meaning; its heat was
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: immeasurable. Suffice it to say that if such a tempest could have swept
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: over Earth for a second, both the poles would have boiled. The
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: travellers left it galloping over that plain, rippled from underneath
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: by the restless earthquake and whipped into flaming foam by the force
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: of the storm. The Sun already was receding from them, already growing
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: smaller. Soon the storm seemed but a cloud of light sweeping over the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: empty plain, like a murderous mourner rushing swiftly away from the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: grave of that mighty mountain.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And now the Professor's spell gripped them in earnest: rapidly the Sun
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: grew smaller. As swiftly as he had sent them upon that journey he was
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: now drawing them home. They overtook thunders that they had heard
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: already, and passed them, and came again to the silent spaces which the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: thunders of the Sun are unable to cross, so that even Mercury is
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: undisturbed by them.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: I have said that spirits neither fade nor weary. But a great sadness
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: was on them; they felt as men feel who come whole away from periods of
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: peril. They had seen cataclysms too vast for our imagination, and a
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: mournfulness and a satiety were upon them. They could have gazed at one
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: flower for days and needed no other experience, as a wounded man may be
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: happy staring at the flame of a candle.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Crossing the paths of Mercury and Venus, they saw that these planets
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: had not appreciably moved, and Rodriguez, who knew that planets wander
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: in the night, guessed thereby that they had not been absent from Earth
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: for many hours.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: They rejoiced to see the Sun diminishing steadily. Only for a moment as
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: they started their journey had they seen that solar storm rushing over
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the plains of the Sun; but now it appeared to hang halted in its mid
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: anger, as though blasting one region eternally.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Moving on with the pace of light, they saw Earth, soon after crossing
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the path of Venus, beginning to grow larger than a star. Never had home
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: appeared more welcome to wanderers, who see their house far off,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: returning home.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And as Earth grew larger, and they began to see forms that seemed like
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: seas and mountains, they looked for their own country, but could not
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: find it: for, travelling straight from the Sun, they approached that
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: part of the world that was then turned towards it, and were heading
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: straight for China, while Spain lay still in darkness.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: But when they came near Earth and its mountains were clear, then the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Professor drew them across the world, into the darkness and over Spain;
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: so that those two spirits ended their marvellous journey much as the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: snipe ends his, a drop out of heaven and a swoop low over marshes. So
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: they came home, while Earth seemed calling to them with all her voices;
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: with memories, sights and scents, and little sounds; calling anxiously,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: as though they had been too long away and must be home soon. They heard
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: a cock crow on the edge of the night; they heard more little sounds
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: than words can say; only the organ can hint at them. It was Earth
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: calling. For, talk as we may of our dreams that transcend this sphere,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: or our hopes that build beyond it, Mother Earth has yet a mighty hold
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: upon us; and her myriad sounds were blending in one cry now, knowing
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: that it was late and that these two children of hers were nearly lost.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: For our spirits that sometimes cross the path of the angels, and on
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: rare evenings hear a word of their talk, and have brief equality with
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the Powers of Light, have the duty also of moving fingers and toes,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: which freeze if our proud spirits forget their task for too long.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And just as Earth was despairing they reached the Professor's mountain
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: and entered the room in which their bodies were.
