author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Blue and cold and ugly looked the body of Morano, but for all its
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: pallor there was beauty in the young face of Rodriguez.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: The Professor stood before them as he had stood when their spirits
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: left, with the table between him and the bodies, and the bowl on the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: table which held the green flame, now low and flickering desperately,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: which the Professor watched as it leaped and failed, with an air of
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: anxiety that seemed to pinch his thin features.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: With an impatience strange to him he waved a swift hand towards each of
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the two bodies where they sat stiff, illumined by the last of the green
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: light; and at those rapid gestures the travellers returned to their
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: habitations.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: They seemed to be just awakening out of deep sleep. Again they saw the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Professor standing before them. But they saw him only with blinking
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: eyes, they saw him only as eyes can see, guessing at his mind from the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: lines of his face, at his thoughts from the movements of his hands,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: guessing as men guess, blindly: only a moment before they had known him
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: utterly. Now they were dazed and forgetting: slow blood began to creep
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: again to their toes and to come again to its place under fingernails:
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: it came with intense pain: they forgot their spirits. Then all the woes
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: of Earth crowded their minds at once, so that they wished to weep, as
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: infants weep.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: The Professor gave this mood time to change, as change it presently
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: did. For the warm blood came back and lit their cheeks, and a tingling
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: succeeded the pain in their fingers and toes, and a mild warmth
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: succeeded the tingling: their thoughts came back to the things of every
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: day, to mundane things and the affairs of the body. Therein they
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: rejoiced, and Morano no less than Rodriguez; though it was a coarse and
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: common body that Morano's spirit inhabited. And when the Professor saw
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: that the first sorrow of Earth, which all spirits feel when they land
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: here, had passed away, and that they were feeling again the joy of
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: mundane things, only then did he speak.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Senor," he said, "beyond the path of Mars run many worlds that I would
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: have you know. The greatest of these is Jupiter, towards whom all that
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: follow my most sacred art show reverent affection. The smallest are
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: those that sometimes strike our world, flaming all green upon November
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: nights, and are even as small as apples." He spoke of our world with a
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: certain air and a pride, as though, through virtue of his transcendent
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: art, the world were only his. "The world that we name Argola," he said,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "is far smaller than Spain and, being invisible from Earth, is only
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: known to the few who have spoken to spirits whose wanderings have
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: surpassed the path of Mars. Nearly half of Argola you shall find
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: covered with forests, which though very dense are no deeper than moss,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: and the elephants in them are not larger than beetles. You shall see
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: many wonders of smallness in this world of Argola, which I desire in
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: especial to show you, since it is the orb with which we who study the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Art are most familiar, of all the worlds that the vulgar have not
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: known. It is indeed the prize of our traffic in those things that far
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: transcend the laws that have forbidden them."
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And as he said this the green flame in the bowl before him died, and he
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: moved towards his cupboard of wonder. Rodriguez hastily thanked the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Professor for his great courtesy in laying bare before him secrets that
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the centuries hid, and then he referred to his own great unworthiness,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: to the lateness of the hour, to the fatigue of the Professor, and to
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the importance to Learning of adequate rest to refresh his illustrious
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: mind. And all that he said the Professor parried with bows, and drew
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: enchantments from his cupboard of wonder to replenish the bowl on the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: table. And Rodriguez saw that he was in the clutch of a collector, one
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: who having devoted all his days to a hobby will exhibit his treasures
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: to the uttermost, and that the stars that magic knows were no less to
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the Professor than all the whatnots that a man collects and insists on
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: showing to whomsoever enters his house. He feared some terrible
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: journey, perhaps some bare escape; for though no material thing can
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: quite encompass a spirit, he knew not what wanderers he might not meet
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: in lonely spaces beyond the path of Mars. So when his last polite
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: remonstrance failed, being turned aside with a pleasant phrase and a
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: smile from the grim lips, and looking at Morano he saw that he shared
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: his fears, then he determined to show whatever resistance were needed
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: to keep himself and Morano in this old world that we know, or that
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: youth at least believes that it knows.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: He watched the Professor return with his packets of wonder; dust from a
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: fallen star, phials of tears of lost lovers, poison and gold out of
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: elf-land, and all manner of things. But the moment that he put them
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: into the bowl Rodriguez' hand flew to his sword-hilt. He heaved up his
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: elbow, but no sword came forth, for it lay magnetised to its scabbard
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: by the grip of a current of magic. When Rodriguez saw this he knew not
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: what to do.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: The Professor went on pouring into the bowl. He added an odour
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: distilled out of dream-roses, three drops from the gall-bladder of a
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: fabulous beast, and a little dust that had been man. More too he added,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: so that my reader might wonder were I to tell him all; yet it is not so
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: easy to free our spirits from the gross grip of our bodies. Wonder not
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: then, my reader, if the Professor exerted strange powers. And all the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: while Morano was picking at a nail that fastened on the handle to his
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: frying-pan.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And just as the last few mysteries were shaken into the bowl,--and
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: there were two among them of which even Asia is ignorant,--just as the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: dews were blended with the powers in a grey-green sinister harmony,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Morano untwisted his nail and got the handle loose.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: The Professor kindled the mixture in the bowl; again green flame arose,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: again that voice of his began to call to their spirits, and its beauty
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: and the power of its spell were as of some fallen angel. The spirit of
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Rodriguez was nearly passing helplessly forth again on some frightful
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: journey, when Morano losed his scabbard and sword from its girdle and
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: tied the handle of his frying-pan across it a little below the hilt
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: with a piece of string. Across the table the Professor intoned his
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: spell, across a narrow table, but it seemed to come from the far side
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: of the twilight, a twilight red and golden in long layers, of an
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: evening wonderfully long ago. It seemed to take its music out of the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: lights that it flowed through and to call Rodriguez from immediately
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: far away, with a call which it were sacrilege to refuse, and anguish
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: even, and hard toil such as there was no strength to do. And then
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Morano held up the sword in its scabbard with the handle of the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: frying-pan tied across. Rodriguez, disturbed by a stammer in the spell,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: looked up and saw the Professor staring at the sword where Morano held
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: it up before his face in the green light of the flame from the bowl. He
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: did not seem like a fallen angel now. His spell had stopped. He seemed
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: like a professor who had forgotten the theme of his lecture, while the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: class waits. For Morano was holding up the sign of the cross.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "You have betrayed me!" shouted the Slave of Orion: the green flame
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: died, and he strode out of the room, his purple cloak floating behind
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: him.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Master," Morano said, "it was always good against magic."
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: The sword was loose in the scabbard as Rodriguez took it back; there
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: was no longer a current of magic gripping the steel.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: A little uneasily Rodriguez thanked Morano: he was not sure if Morano
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: had behaved as a guest's servant should. But when he thought of the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Professor's terrible spells, which had driven them to the awful crags
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: of the sun, and might send them who knows where to hob-nob with who
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: knows what, his second thoughts perceived that Morano was right to cut
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: short those arts that the Slave of Orion loved, even by so extreme a
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: step: and he praised Morano as his ready shrewdness deserved.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "We were very nearly too late back from that outing, master," remarked
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Morano.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "How know you that?" said Rodriguez.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "This old body knew," said Morano. "Those heart-thumpings, this
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: warmness, and all the things that make a fat body comfortable, they
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: were stopping, master, they were spoiling, they were getting cold and
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: strange: I go no more errands for that senor."
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: A certain diffidence about criticising his host even now; and a very
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: practical vein that ran through his nature, now showing itself in
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: anxiety for a bed at so late an hour, led Rodriguez to change the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: subject. He wanted that aged butler, yet dare not ring the bell; for he
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: feared lest with all the bells there might be in use that frightful
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: practice that he had met by the outer door, a chain connected with some
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: hideous hook that gave anguish to something in the basement whenever
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: one touched the handle, so that the menials of that grim Professor were
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: shrilly summoned by screams. And therefore Rodriguez sought counsel of
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Morano, who straightway volunteered to find the butler's quarters, by a
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: certain sense that he had of the fitness of things: and forth he went,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: but would not leave the room without the scabbard and the handle of the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

author: Dunsany, Lord

author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

author: Dunsany, Lord

author: Dunsany, Lord

author: Dunsany, Lord

author: Dunsany, Lord

author: Dunsany, Lord

author: Dunsany, Lord

author: Dunsany, Lord

author: Dunsany, Lord

author: Dunsany, Lord

author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley

text: Rodriguez, who loved philosophy, turned his mind at once to the journey
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: that lay before him, deciding which was the north; for he knew that it
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: leave since there were no wars in that country.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Morano knew not clearly what philosophy was, yet he wasted no thoughts
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: upon the night that was gone; and, fitting up his frying-pan
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: immediately, he brought out what was left of his bacon and began to
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: bushes, scattered here and there.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Rodriguez, far from ruminating upon the events of the previous night,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: realised as he watched these preparations that he was enormously
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: arose, he who had held the chair of magic at Saragossa was banished
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: from both their minds, although upon this very spot they had spent so
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: things of yesterday are often forgotten.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Morano," said Rodriguez, "we must walk far to-day."
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Indeed, master," said Morano, "we must push on to these wars; for you
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: have no castle, master, no lands, no fortune ..."
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Come," said Rodriguez.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Morano slung his frying-pan behind him: they had eaten up the last of
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: his bacon: he stood up, and they were ready for the journey. The smoke
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: from their meagre fire went thinly into the air, the small grey clouds
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: of it went slowly up: nothing beside remained to bid them farewell, or
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: for them to thank for their strange night's hospitality. They climbed
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: till they reached the rugged crest of the mountain; thence they saw a
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: wide plain and the morning: the day was waiting for them.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: The northern slope of the mountain was wholly different from that black
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: congregation of angry rocks through which they had climbed by night to
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the House of Wonder.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: The slope that now lay before them was smooth and grassy, flowing
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: before them far, a gentle slope that was soon to lend speed to
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Rodriguez' feet, adding nimbleness even to youth. Soon, too, it was to
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: lift onward the dull weight of Morano as he followed his master towards
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: unknown wars, youth going before him like a spirit and the good slope
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: helping behind. But before they gave themselves to that waiting journey
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: they stood a moment and looked at the shining plain that lay before
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: them like an open page, on which was the whole chronicle of that day's
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: wayfaring. There was the road they should travel by, there were the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: streams it crossed and narrow woods they might rest in, and dim on the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: farthest edge was the place they must spend that night. It was all, as
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: it were written, upon the plain they watched, but in a writing not
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: intended for them, and, clear although it be, never to be interpreted
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: by one of our race. Thus they saw clear, from a height, the road they
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: would go by, but not one of all the events to which it would lead them.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Master," said Morano, "shall we have more adventures to-day?"
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "I trust so," said Rodriguez. "We have far to go, and it will be dull
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: journeying without them."
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Morano turned his eyes from his master's face and looked back to the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: plain. "There, master," he said, "where our road runs through a wood,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: will our adventure be there, think you? Or there, perhaps," and he
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: waved his hand widely farther.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "No," said Rodriguez, "we pass that in bright daylight."
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Is that not good for adventure?" said Morano.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "The romances teach," said Rodriguez, "that twilight or night are
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: better. The shade of deep woods is favourable, but there are no such
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: woods on this plain. When we come to evening we shall doubtless meet
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: some adventure, far over there." And he pointed to the grey rim of the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: plain where it started climbing towards hills.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "These are good days," said Morano. He forgot how short a time ago he
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: had said regretfully that these days were not as the old days. But our
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: race, speaking generally, is rarely satisfied with the present, and
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Morano's cheerfulness had not come from his having risen suddenly
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: superior to this everyday trouble of ours; it came from his having
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: shifted his gaze to the future. Two things are highly tolerable to us,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: and even alluring, the past and the future. It was only with the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: present that Morano was ever dissatisfied.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: When Morano said that the days were good Rodriguez set out to find
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: them, or at least that one that for some while now lay waiting for them
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: on the plain. He strode down the slope at once and, endowing nature
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: with his own impatience, he felt that he heard the morning call to him
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: wistfully. Morano followed.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: For an hour these refugees escaping from peace went down the slope; and
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: in that hour they did five swift miles, miles that seemed to run by
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: them as they walked, and so they came lightly to the level plain. And
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: in the next hour they did four miles more. Words were few, either
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: because Morano brooded mainly upon one thought, the theme of which was
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: his lack of bacon, or because he kept his breath to follow his master
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: who, with youth and the morning, was coming out of the hills at a pace
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: not tuned to Morano's forty years or so. And at the end of these nine
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: miles Morano perceived a house, a little way from the road, on the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: left, upon rising ground. A mile or so ahead they saw the narrow wood
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: that they had viewed in the morning from the mountain running across
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the plain. They saw now by the lie of the ground that it probably
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: followed a stream, a pleasant place in which to take the rest demanded
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: by Spain at noon. It was just an hour to noon; so Rodriguez, keeping
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the road, told Morano to join him where it entered the wood when he had
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: acquired his bacon. And then as they parted a thought occurred to
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Rodriguez, which was that bacon cost money. It was purely an
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: afterthought, an accidental fancy, such as inspirations are, for he had
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: never had to buy bacon. So he gave Morano a fifth part of his money, a
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: large gold coin the size of one of our five-shilling pieces, engraved
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: of course upon one side with the glories and honours of that golden
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: period of Spain, and upon the other with the head of the lord the King.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: It was only by chance he had brought any at all; he was not what our
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: newspapers will call, if they ever care to notice him, a level-headed
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: business man. At the sight of the gold piece Morano bowed, for he felt
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: this gift of gold to be an occasion; but he trusted more for the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: purchase of the bacon to some few small silver coins of his own that he
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: kept among lumps of lard and pieces of string.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley

author: Dunsany, Lord

author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: eyes.

author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: gave him an air not unlike that which the King himself sometimes wore

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: courtesy.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "It is not a bull-fight," said the chief of la Garda almost
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: apologetically. But Rodriguez waved aside his deprecations and declared
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: himself charmed at the prospect of a hanging.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Bear with me, reader, while I champion a bad cause and seek to palliate
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: what is inexcusable. As we travel about the world on our way through
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: life we meet and pass here and there, in peace or in war, other men,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: fellow-travellers: and sometimes there is no more than time for a
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: glance, eye to eye. And in that glance you see the sort of man: and
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: chiefly there are two sorts. The one sort always brooding, always
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: planning; mean, silent men, collecting properties and money; keeping
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: and heaven, and the late, leisurely judgment of simple people: and the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: others merry folk, whose eyes twinkle, whose money flies, who will
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: sooner laugh than plan, who seem to inherit rightfully the happiness
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: that the others plot for, and fail to come by with all their schemes.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: In the man who was to provide the entertainment Rodriguez recognised
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the second kind.

author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

author: Dunsany, Lord

text: that it was his duty to help the law while help was needed, and to
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: sacred thing man had made, if indeed it were not divine; but since the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley

author: Dunsany, Lord

text: closely, it appeared to him the blindest, silliest thing with which he

author: Dunsany, Lord

text: They looked up with questions ripe to drop from their lips when they
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: saw Rodriguez returning with Morano. But before one of them spoke
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Morano flung to them from far off a little piece of his wisdom: for
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: cast a truth into an occasion and it will always trouble the waters,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: usually stirring up contradiction, but always bringing something to the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: surface.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Senores," he said, "no man can enjoy a hanging with a dry throat."
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Thus he turned their attention a while from the business in hand,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: changing their thoughts from the stout neck of the prisoner to their
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: own throats, wondering were they dry; and you do not wonder long about
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: this in the south without finding that what you feared is true. And
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: then he let them see the two great bottles, all full of wine, for the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: invention of the false bottom that gives to our champagne-bottles the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: place they rightly hold among famous deceptions had not as yet been
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: discovered.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "It is true," said la Garda. And Rodriguez made Morano put one of the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: bottles away in a piece of a sack that he carried: and when la Garda
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: saw one of the two bottles disappear it somehow decided them to have
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the other, though how this came to be so there is no saying; and thus
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the hanging was postponed again.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Now the drink was a yellow wine, sweet and heavy and stronger than our
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: port; only our whisky could out-triumph it, but there in the warm south
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: it answered its purpose. Rodriguez beckoned Morano up and offered the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: bottle to one of la Garda; but scarcely had he put it to his lips when
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Rodriguez bade him stop, saying that he had had his share. And he did
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the same with the next man.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Now there be few things indeed which la Garda resent more than meagre
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: hospitality in the matter of drink, and with all their wits striving to
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: cope with this vicious defect in Rodriguez, as they rightly or wrongly
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: regarded it, how should they have any to spare for obvious precautions?
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: As the third man drank, Rodriguez turned to speak to Morano; and the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: representative of the law took such advantage of an opportunity that he
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: feared to be fleeting, that when Rodriguez turned round again the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: bottle was just half empty. Rodriguez had timed it very nicely.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Next Rodriguez put the bottle to his lips and held it there a little
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: time, while the fourth man of the law, who was guarding the prisoner,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: watched Rodriguez wistfully, and afterwards Morano, who took the bottle
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: next. Yet neither Rodriguez nor Morano drank.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "You can finish the bottle," said Rodriguez to this anxious watcher,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: who came forward eagerly though full of doubts, which changed to warm
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: feelings of exuberant gratitude when he found how much remained. Thus
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: he obtained not much less than two tumblerfuls of wine that, as I have
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: said, was stronger than port; and noon was nearing and it was spring in
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Spain. And then he returned to guard his prisoner under the oak-tree
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: and lay down there on the moss, remembering that it was his duty to
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: keep awake. And afterwards with one hand he took hold of a rope that
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: bound the prisoner's ankles, so that he might still guard his prisoner
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: even though he should fall asleep.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Now two of the men had had little more than the full of a sherry glass
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: each. To these Morano made signs that there was another bottle, and,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: coming round behind his master, he covertly uncorked it and gave them
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: their heart's desire; and a little was left over for the man who drank
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: third on the first occasion. And presently the spirits of all four of
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: la Garda grew haughty and forgot their humble bodies, and would fain
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: have gone forth to dwell with the sons of light, while their bodies lay
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: on the moss and the sun grew warmer and warmer, shining dappled in
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: amongst the small green leaves. All seemed still but for the winged
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: insects flashing through shafts of the sunlight out of the gloom of the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: trees and disappearing again like infinitesimal meteors. But our
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: concern is with the thoughts of man, of which deeds are but the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: shadows: wherever these are active it is wrong to say all is still; for
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: whether they cast their shadows, which are actions, or whether they
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: remain a force not visibly stirring matter, they are the source of the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: tales we write and the lives we lead; it is they that gave History her
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: material and they that bade her work it up into books.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And thoughts were very active about that oak-tree. For while the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: thoughts of la Garda arose like dawn, and disappeared into mists, their
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: prisoner was silently living through the sunny days of his life, which
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: are at no time quite lost to us, and which flash vivid and bright and
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: near when memory touches them, herself awakened by the nearness of
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: death. He lived again days far from the day that had brought him where
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: he stood. He drew from those days (that is to say) that delight, that
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: essence of hours, that something which we call life. The sun, the wind,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the rough sand, the splash of the sea, on the star-fish, and all the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: things that it feels during its span, are stored in something like its
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: memory, and are what we call its life: it is the same with all of us.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Life is feeling. The prisoner from the store of his memory was taking
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: all he had. His head was lifted, he was gazing northwards, far further
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: than his eyes could see, to shining spaces in great woods; and there
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: his threatened being walked in youth, with steps such as spirits take,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: over immortal flowers, which were dim and faint but unfading because
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: they lived on in memory. In memory he walked with some who were now far
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: from his footsteps. And, seen through the gloaming of that perilous
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: day, how bright did those far days appear! Did they not seem sunnier
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: than they really were? No, reader; for all the radiance that glittered
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: so late in his mind was drawn from those very days; it was their own
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: brightness that was shining now: we are not done with the days that
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: were as soon as their sunsets have faded, but a light remains from them
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: and grows fairer and fairer, like an afterglow lingering among
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: tremendous peaks above immeasurable slopes of snow.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: The prisoner had scarcely noticed Rodriguez or his servant, any more
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: than he noticed his captors; for there come an intensity to those who
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: walk near death that makes them a little alien from other men, life
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: flaring up in them at the last into so grand a flame that the lives of
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the others seem a little cold and dim where they dwell remote from that
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: sunset that we call mortality. So he looked silently at the days that
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: were as they came dancing back again to him from where they had long
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: lain lost in chasms of time, to which they had slipped over dark edges
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: of years. Smiling they came, but all wistfully anxious, as though their
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: errand were paramount and their span short: he saw them cluster about
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: him, running now, bringing their tiny gifts, and scarcely heard the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: heavy sigh of his guard as Rodriguez gagged him and Morano tied him up.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Had Rodriguez now released the prisoner they could have been three to
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: three, in the event of things going wrong with the sleep of la Garda;
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: but, since in the same time they could gag and bind another, the odds
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: would be the same at two to two, and Rodriguez preferred this to the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: slight uncertainties that would be connected with the entry of another
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: partner. They accordingly gagged the next man and bound his wrists and
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: ankles. And that Spanish wine held good with the other two and bound
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: them far down among the deeps of dreams: and so it should, for it was
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: of a vine that grew in the vales of Spain and had ripened in one of the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: years of the golden age.

author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Shall we gag him, master, like the rest?" said Morano.

author: Dunsany, Lord

author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "No," said Rodriguez. "He has nothing to say."
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And though this remark turned out to be strictly untrue, it well enough

author: Dunsany, Lord

text: answered its purpose.

text: And then they saw standing before them the man they had freed. And he
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley

author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

author: Dunsany, Lord

author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Senor," he said, "being a busy man, I have seldom time to pray. And
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the blessed Saints, being more busy than I, I think seldom hear my
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley

author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

author: Dunsany, Lord

author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Senor," Rodriguez said, "I profoundly thank you."
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley

text: At this word Morano's interest awakened wide. "Senor," he said, "what

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley

author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Where is your home, senor?" Rodriguez asked.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley

author: Dunsany, Lord

author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: chin: he had heard of Shadow Valley only dimly, for all the travellers
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: he had known out of the north had gone round it. Rodriguez and Morano
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: bent their heads and watched a design that was growing out of the gold.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: talk of the horses. He spoke as though his plans had been clearly
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley

text: Fernandez."

author: Dunsany, Lord

author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: gold, for the worker had hollowed the coin away all around it, and was

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley

author: Dunsany, Lord

author: Dunsany, Lord

author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Master," Morano answered, "these hands can hold till evening."

author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: knees. Rodriguez led the way on to the straggling road and was soon
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

author: Dunsany, Lord

author: Dunsany, Lord

author: Dunsany, Lord

author: Dunsany, Lord
