text: must, and welcome."
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Not always," said Rodriguez somewhat curtly, for it struck him that
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Morano spoke somehow too lightly of sacred things.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Not always?" asked Morano.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "No," said Rodriguez.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Master, I implore you tell me," said Morano, "when they may kill you
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: and when they may not, so that I may never offend again."
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Rodriguez cast a swift glance at him but found his face so full of
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: puzzled anxiety that he condescended to do what Morano had asked, and
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: began to explain to him the rudiments of the laws of Chivalry.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "In the wars," he said, "you may defend me whoever assails me, or if
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: robbers or any common persons attack me, but if I arrange a meeting
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: with a gentleman, and any knave basely interferes, then is he damned
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: hereafter as well as accursed now; for, the laws of Chivalry being
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: founded on true religion, the penalty for their breach is by no means
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: confined to this world."
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Master," replied Morano thoughtfully, "if I be not damned already I
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: will avoid those fires of Hell; and none shall kill you that you have
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: not chosen to kill you, and those that you choose shall kill you
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: whenever you have a mind."
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Rodriguez opened his lips to correct Morano but reflected that, though
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: in his crude and base-born way, he had correctly interpreted the law so
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: far as his mind was able.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: So he briefly said "Yes," and rose and returned to the road, giving
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Morano no order to follow him; and this was the last concession he made
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: to the needs of Chivalry on account of the sin of Morano. Morano
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: gathered up the frying-pan and followed Rodriguez, and when they came
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: to the road he walked behind him in silence.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: For three or four miles they walked thus, Morano knowing that he
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: followed on sufferance and calling no attention to himself with his
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: garrulous tongue. But at the end of an hour the rain lifted; and with
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the coming out of the sun Morano talked again.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Master," he said, "the next man that you choose to kill you, let him
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: be one too base-born to know the tricks of the rapier, too ignorant to
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: do aught but wish you well, some poor fat fool over forty who shall be
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: too heavy to elude your rapier's point and too elderly for it to matter
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: when you kill him at your Chivalry, the best of life being gone already
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: at forty-five."
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "There is timber here," said Rodriguez. "We will have some more bacon
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: while you dry my cloak over a fire."
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Thus he acknowledged Morano again for his servant but never
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: acknowledged that in Morano's words he had understood any poor sketch
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: of Morano's self, or that the words went to his heart.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Timber, Master?" said Morano, though it did not need Rodriguez to
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: point out the great oaks that now began to stand beside their journey,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: but he saw that the other matter was well and thus he left well alone.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Rodriguez waved an arm towards the great trees. "Yes, indeed," said
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Morano, and began to polish up the frying-pan as he walked.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Rodriguez, who missed little, caught a glimpse of tears in Morano's
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: eyes, for all that his head was turned downward over the frying-pan;
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: yet he said nothing, for he knew that forgiveness was all that Morano
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: needed, and that he had now given him: and it was much to give,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: reflected Rodriguez, for so great a crime, and dismissed the matter
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: from his mind.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And now their road dipped downhill, and they passed a huge oak and then
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: another. More and more often now they met these solitary giants, till
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: their view began to be obscured by them. The road dwindled till it was
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: no better than a track, the earth beside it was wild and rocky;
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Rodriguez wondered to what manner of land he was coming. But
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: continually the branches of some tree obscured his view and the only
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: indication he had of it was from the road he trod, which seemed to tell
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: him that men came here seldom. Beyond every huge tree that they passed
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: as they went downhill Rodriguez hoped to get a better view, but always
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: there stood another to close the vista. It was some while before he
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: realised that he had entered a forest. They were come to Shadow Valley.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: The grandeur of this place, penetrated by shafts of sunlight, coloured
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: by flashes of floating butterflies, filled by the chaunt of birds
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: rising over the long hum of insects, lifted the fallen spirits of
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Rodriguez as he walked on through the morning.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: He still would not have exchanged his rose for the whole forest; but in
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the mighty solemnity of the forest his mourning for the lady that he
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: feared he had lost no longer seemed the only solemn thing: indeed, the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: sombre forest seemed well attuned to his mood; and what complaint have
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: we against Fate wherever this is so. His mood was one of tragic loss,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the defeat of an enterprise that his hopes had undertaken, to seize
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: victory on the apex of the world, to walk all his days only just
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: outside the edge of Paradise, for no less than that his hopes and his
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: first love promised each other; and then he walked despairing in small
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: rain. In this mood Fate had led him to solemn old oaks standing huge
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: among shadows; and the grandeur of their grey grip on the earth that
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: had been theirs for centuries was akin to the grandeur of the high
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: hopes he had had, and his despair was somehow soothed by the shadows.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And then the impudent birds seemed to say "Hope again."
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: They walked for miles into the forest and lit a fire before noon, for
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Rodriguez had left Lowlight very early. And by it Morano cooked bacon
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: again and dried his master's cloak. They ate the bacon and sat by the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: fire till all their clothes were dry, and when the flames from the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: great logs fell and only embers glowed they sat there still, with hands
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: spread to the warmth of the embers; for to those who wander a fire is
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: food and rest and comfort. Only as the embers turned grey did they
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: throw earth over their fire and continue their journey. Their road grew
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: smaller and the forest denser.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: They had walked some miles from the place where they lit their fire,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: when a somewhat unmistakable sound made Rodriguez look ahead of him. An
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: arrow had struck a birch tree on the right side, ten or twelve paces in
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: front of him; and as he looked up another struck it from the opposite
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: side just level with the first; the two were sticking in it ten feet or
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: so from the ground. Rodriguez drew his sword. But when a third arrow
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: went over his head from behind and struck the birch tree, whut! just
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: between the other two, he perceived, as duller minds could have done,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: that it was a hint, and he returned his sword and stood still. Morano
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: questioned his master with his eyes, which were asking what was to be
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: done next. But Rodriguez shrugged his shoulders: there was no fighting
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: with an invisible foe that could shoot like that. That much Morano
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: knew, but he did not know that there might not be some law of Chivalry
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: that would demand that Rodriguez should wave his sword in the air or
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: thrust at the birch tree until someone shot him. When there seemed to
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: be no such rule Morano was well content. And presently men came quietly
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: on to the road from different parts of the wood. They were dressed in
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: brown leather and wore leaf-green hats, and round each one's neck hung
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: a disk of engraved copper. They came up to the travellers carrying
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: bows, and the leader said to Rodriguez:
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Senor, all travellers here bring tribute to the King of Shadow
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Valley," at the mention of whom all touched hats and bowed their heads.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "What do you bring us?"
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Rodriguez thought of no answer; but after a moment he said, for the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: sake of loyalty: "I know one king only."
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "There is only one king in Shadow Valley," said the bowman.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "He brings a tribute of emeralds," said another, looking at Rodriguez'
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: scabbard. And then they searched him and others search Morano. There
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: were eight or nine of them, all in their leaf-green hats, with ribbons
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: round their necks of the same colour to hold the copper disks. They
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: took a gold coin from Morano and grey greasy pieces of silver. One of
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: them took his frying-pan; but he looked so pitifully at them as he said
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: simply, "I starve," that the frying-pan was restored to him.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: They unbuckled Rodriguez' belt and took from him sword and scabbard and
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: three gold pieces from his purse. Next they found the gold piece that
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: was hanging round his neck, still stuffed inside his clothes where he
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: had put it when he was riding. Having examined it they put it back
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: inside his clothes, while the leader rebuckled his sword-belt about his
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: waist and returned him his three gold-pieces.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Others returned his money to Morano. "Master," said the leader, bowing
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: to Rodriguez, his green hat in hand, "under our King, the forest is
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: yours."
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Morano was pleased to hear this respect paid to his master, but
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Rodriguez was so surprised that he who was never curt without reason
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: found no more to say than "Why?"
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Because we are your servants," said the other.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Who are you?" asked Rodriguez.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "We are the green bowmen, master," he said, "who hold this forest
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: against all men for our King."
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "And who is he?" said Rodriguez.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And the bowman answered: "The King of Shadow Valley," at which the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: others all touched hats and bowed heads again. And Rodriguez seeing
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: that the mystery would grow no clearer for any information to be had
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: from them said: "Conduct me to your king."
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "That, master, we cannot do," said the chief of the bowmen. "There be
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: many trees in this forest, and behind any one of them he holds his
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: court. When he needs us there is his clear horn. But when men need him
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: who knows which shadow is his of all that lie in the forest?" Whether
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: or not there was anything interesting in the mystery, to Rodriguez it
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: was merely annoying; and finding it grew no clearer he turned his
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: attention to shelter for the night, to which all travellers give a
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: thought at least once, between noon and sunset.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Is there any house on this road, senor," he said, "in which we could
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: rest the night?"
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Ten miles from here," said he, "and not far from the road you take is
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the best house we have in the forest. It is yours, master, for as long
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: as you honour it."
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Come then," said Rodriguez, "and I thank you, senor."
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: So they all started together, Rodriguez with the leader going in front
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: and Morano following with all the bowmen. And soon the bowmen were
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: singing songs of the forest, hunting songs, songs of the winter; and
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: songs of the long summer evenings, songs of love. Cheered by this
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: merriment, the miles slipped by.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And Rodriguez gathered from the songs they sang something of what they
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: were and of how they lived in the forest, living amongst the woodland
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: creatures till these men's ways were almost as their ways; killing what
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: they needed for food but protecting the woodland things against all
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: others; straying out amongst the villages in summer evenings, and
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: always welcome; and owning no allegiance but to the King of the Shadow
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Valley.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And the leader told Rodriguez that his name was Miguel Threegeese,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: given him on account of an exploit in his youth when he lay one night
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: with his bow by one of the great pools in the forest, where the geese
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: come in winter. He said the forest was a hundred miles long, lying
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: mostly along a great valley, which they were crossing. And once they
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: had owned allegiance to kings of Spain, but now to none but the King of
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: some of the forest down, and the forest was sacred.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: in the villages: with singing and laughter they came to their journey's
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: end. A cottage as though built by peasants with boundless material
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: stood in the forest. It was a thatched cottage built in the peasant's

author: Dunsany, Lord

text: way but of enormous size. The leader entered first and whispered to
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: those within, who rose and bowed to Rodriguez as he entered, twenty

author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley

text: same strange leafy crown. "Wear it as you go through Shadow Valley," he

author: Dunsany, Lord

author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley

author: Dunsany, Lord

author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Why should he know? Of course because he bore the design himself. "Who

author: Dunsany, Lord

text: wears it?" said Rodriguez.

author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley

text: "The King of Shadow Valley."

author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Morano was without curiosity; he did not question good drink; he sat at
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the table with a cup of horn in his hand, as happy as though he had
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: The sun sank under the oaks, filling the hall with a ruddy glow,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: turning the boar spears scarlet and reddening the red faces of the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: merry men of the bow.

author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: A dozen of the men went out; to relieve the guard in the forest, Miguel
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: explained. And Rodriguez learned that he had come through a line of
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: their posts and unslung their bows and laid them on pegs on the wall
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: prince of the forest." What did it mean?

author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Soon the long hall grew dim, and his love for the light drew Rodriguez
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: out to watch the sunset. And there was the sun under indescribable
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: clouds, turning huge and yellow among the trunks of the trees and
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: casting glory munificently down glades. It set, and the western sky
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: became blood-red and lilac: from the other end of the sky the moon
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: peeped out of night. A hush came and a chill, and a glory of colour,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: and a dying away of light; and in the hush the mystery of the great
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: oaks became magical. A blackbird blew a tune less of this earth than of
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: fairy-land.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Rodriguez wished that he could have had a less ambition than to win a
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: castle in the wars, for in those glades and among those oaks he felt
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: that happiness might be found under roofs of thatch. But having come by
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: his ambition he would not desert it.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Now rushlights were lit in the great cottage and the window of the long
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: room glowed yellow. A fountain fell in the stillness that he had not
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: heard before. An early nightingale tuned a tentative note. "The forest
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: is fair, is it not?" said Miguel.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Rodriguez had no words to say. To turn into words the beauty that was
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: now shining in his thoughts, reflected from the evening there, was no
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: easier than for wood to reflect all that is seen in the mirror.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "You love the forest," he said at last.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Master," said Miguel, "it is the only land in which we should live our
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: days. There are cities and roads but man is not meant for them. I know
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: not, master, what God intends about us; but in cities we are against
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the intention at every step, while here, why, we drift along with it."
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "I, too, would live here always," said Rodriguez.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "The house is yours," said Miguel. And Rodriguez answered: "I go

text: tomorrow to the wars."

author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: They turned round then and walked slowly back to the cottage, and
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: of the twilight. But they passed from the room at once by a door on the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: cottage.

author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Your room, master," said Miguel Threegeese.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: It was not so big as the hall where the bowmen sat, but it was a goodly
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: room. The bed was made of carved wood, for there were craftsmen in the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: their bare timber by some woodland artist. The chairs had not the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: beauty of the great ages of furniture, but they had a dignity that the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: age of commerce has not dreamed of. Each one was carved out of a single
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: block of wood: there was no join in them anywhere. One of them lasts to
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: this day.

author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: The skins of deer covered the long walls. There were great basins and
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: by any jarring conflict with the purposes and traditions of the land in
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: which it stood. All the woodland spirits might have entered there, and
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: slept--if spirits sleep--in the great bed, and left at dawn unoffended.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

author: Dunsany, Lord

author: Dunsany, Lord

author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "That is their kitchen, master," he said. "The whole house is kitchen."

author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Rodriguez rose more relieved to quit so tumultuous a rest than
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: refreshed by having had it.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: He descended, leaving Morano to sleep on, and not till the old dame had
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: made a breakfast ready did he return to interrupt his snores.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Even as he awoke upon his heap of hay Morano remained as true to his
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: master's fantastic quest as the camel is true to the pilgrimage to
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Mecca. He awoke grumbling, as the camel grumbles at dawn when the packs
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: are put on him where he lies, but never did he doubt that they went to
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: victorious wars where his master would win a castle splendid with
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: towers.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Breakfast cheered both the travellers. And then the old lady told
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Rodriguez that Caspe was but a three hours' walk, and that cheered them
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: even more, for Caspe is on the Ebro, which seemed to mark for Rodriguez
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: a stage in his journey, being carried easily in his imagination, like
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the Pyrenees. What road he would take when he reached Caspe he had not
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: planned. And soon Rodriguez expressed his gratitude, full of fervour,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: with many a flowery phrase which lived long in the old dame's mind; and
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the visit of those two travellers became one of the strange events of
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: that house and was chief of the memories that faintly haunted the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: rafters of the loft for years.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: They did not reach Caspe in three hours, but went lazily, being weary;
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: for however long a man defies fatigue the hour comes when it claims
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: him. The knowledge that Caspe lay near with sure lodging for the night,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: soothed Rodriguez' impatience. And as they loitered they talked, and
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: they decided that la Garda must now be too far behind to pursue any
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: longer. They came in four hours to the bank of the Ebro and there saw
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Caspe near them; but they dined once more on the grass, sitting beside
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the river, rather than enter the town at once, for there had grown in
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: both travellers a liking for the wanderers' green table of earth.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: It was a time to make plans. The country of romance was far away and
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: they were without horses.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Will you buy horses, master?" said Morano.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "We might not get them over the Pyrenees," said Rodriguez, though he
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: had a better reason, which was that three gold pieces did not buy two
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: saddled horses. There were no more friends to hire from. Morano grew
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: thoughtful. He sat with his feet dangling over the bank of the Ebro.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Master," he said after a while, "this river goes our way. Let us come
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: by boat, master, and drift down to France at our ease."
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: To get a river over a range of mountains is harder than to get horses.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Some such difficulty Rodriguez implied to him; but Morano, having come
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: slowly by an idea, parted not so easily with it.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "It goes our way, master," he repeated, and pointed a finger at the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Ebro.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: At this moment a certain song that boatmen sing on that river, when the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: current is with them and they have nothing to do but be idle and their
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: lazy thoughts run to lascivious things, came to the ears of Rodriguez
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: and Morano; and a man with a bright blue sash steered down the Ebro. He
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: had been fishing and was returning home.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Master," Morano said, "that knave shall row us there."
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Rodriguez seeing that the idea was fixed in Morano's mind determined
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: that events would move it sooner than argument, and so made no reply.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Shall I tell him, master?" asked Morano.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Yes," said Rodriguez, "if he can row us over the Pyrenees."
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: This was the permission that Morano sought, and a hideous yell broke
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: from his throat hailing the boatman. The boatman looked up lazily, a
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: young man with strong brown arms, turning black moustaches towards
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Morano. Again Morano hailed him and ran along the bank, while the boat
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: drifted down and the boatman steered in towards Morano. Somehow Morano
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: persuaded him to come in to see what he wanted; and in a creek he ran
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: his boat aground, and there he and Morano argued and bargained. But
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Rodriguez remained where he was, wondering why it took so long to turn
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: his servant's mind from that curious fancy. At last Morano returned.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Well?" said Rodriguez.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Master," said Morano, "he will row us to the Pyrenees."
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "The Pyrenees!" said Rodriguez. "The Ebro runs into the sea." For they
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: had taught him this at the college of San Josephus.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "He will row us there," said Morano, "for a gold piece a day, rowing
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: five hours each day."
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Now between them they had but four gold pieces; but that did not make
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the Ebro run northward. It seemed that the Ebro, after going their way,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: as Morano had said, for twenty or thirty miles, was joined by the river
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Segre, and that where the Ebro left them, turning eastwards, the course
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: of the Segre took them on their way: but it would be rowing against the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: current.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "How far is it?" said Rodriguez.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "A hundred miles, he says," answered Morano. "He knows it well."
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Rodriguez calculated swiftly. First he added thirty miles; for he knew
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: that his countrymen took a cheerful view of distance, seldom allowing
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: any distance to oppress them under its true name at the out set of a
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: journey; then he guessed that the boatman might row five miles an hour
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: for the first thirty miles with the stream of the Ebro, and he hoped
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: that he might row three against the Segre until they came near the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: mountains, where the current might grow too strong.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Morano," he said, "we shall have to row too."
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Row, master?" said Morano.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "We can pay him for four days," said Rodriguez. "If we all row we may
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: go far on our way."
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "It is better than riding," replied Morano with entire resignation.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And so they walked to the creek and Rodriguez greeted the boatman,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: whose name was Perez; and they entered the boat and he rowed them down
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: to Caspe. And, in the house of Perez, Rodriguez slept that night in a
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: large dim room, untidy with diverse wares: they slept on heaps of
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: things that pertained to the river and fishing. Yet it was late before
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Rodriguez slept, for in sight of his mind came glimpses at last of the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: end of his journey; and, when he slept at last, he saw the Pyrenees.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Through the long night their mighty heads rejected him, staring
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: immeasurably beyond him in silence, and then in happier dreams they
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: beckoned him for a moment. Till at last a bird that had entered the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: city of Caspe sang clear and it was dawn. With that first light
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Rodriguez arose and awoke Morano. Together they left that long haven of
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: lumber and found Perez already stirring. They ate hastily and all went
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: down to the boat, the unknown that waits at the end of all strange
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: journeys quickening their steps as they went through the early light.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Perez rowed first and the others took their turns and so they went all
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the morning down the broad flood of the Ebro, and came in the afternoon
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: to its meeting place with the Segre. And there they landed and
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: stretched their limbs on shore and lit a fire and feasted, before they
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: faced the current that would be henceforth against them. Then they
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: rowed on.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: When they landed by starlight and unrolled a sheet of canvas that Perez
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: had put in the boat, and found what a bad time starlight is for
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: pitching a tent, Rodriguez and Morano had rowed for four hours each and
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Perez had rowed for five. They carried no timber in the boat but used
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the oars for tent-poles and cut tent-pegs with a small hatchet that
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Perez had brought.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: They stumbled on rocks, tore the canvas on bushes, lost the same thing
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: over and over again; in fact they were learning the craft of wandering.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Yet at last their tent was up and a good fire comforting them outside,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: and Morano had cooked the food and they had supped and talked, and
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: after that they slept. And over them sleeping the starlight faded away,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: and in the greyness that none of them dreamed was dawn five clear notes
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: were heard so shrill in the night that Rodriguez half waking wondered
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: what bird of the darkness called, and learned from the answering chorus
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: that it was day.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: He woke Morano who rose in that chilly hour and, striking sparks among
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: last night's embers, soon had a fire: they hastily made a meal and
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: wrapped up their tent and soon they were going onward against the tide
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: of the Segre. And that day Morano rowed more skilfully; and Rodriguez
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: unwrapped his mandolin and played, reclining in the boat while he
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: rested from rowing. And the mandolin told them all, what the words of
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: none could say, that they fared to adventure in the land of Romance, to
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the overthrow of dullness and the sameness of all drear schemes and the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: conquest of discontent in the spirit of man; and perhaps it sang of a
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: time that has not yet come, or the mandolin lied.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: That evening three wiser men made their camp before starlight. They
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: were now far up the Segre.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: For thirteen hours next day they toiled at the oars or lay languid. And
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: while Rodriguez rested he played on his mandolin. The Segre slipped by
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: them.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: They seemed like no men on their way to war, but seemed to loiter as
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the bright river loitered, which slid seaward in careless ease and was
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: wholly freed from time.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: On this day they heard men speak of the Pyrenees, two men and a woman
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: walking by the river; their voices came to the boat across the water,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: and they spoke of the Pyrenees. And on the next day they heard men
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: speak of war. War that some farmers had fled from on the other side of
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the mountain. When Rodriguez heard these chance words his dreams came
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: nearer till they almost touched the edges of reality.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: It was the last day of Perez' rowing. He rowed well although they
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: neared the cradle of the Segre and he struggled against them in his
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: youth. Grey peaks began to peer that had nursed that river. Grey faces
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: of stone began to look over green hills. They were the Pyrenees.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: When Rodriguez saw at last the Pyrenees he drew a breath and was unable
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: to speak. Soon they were gone again below the hills: they had but
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: peered for a moment to see who troubled the Segre.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And the sun set and still they did not camp, but Perez rowed on into
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the starlight. That day he rowed six hours.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: They pitched their tent as well as they could in the darkness; and,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: breathing a clear new air all crisp from the Pyrenees, they slept
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: outside the threshold of adventure.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Rodriguez awoke cold. Once more he heard the first blackbird who sings
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: clear at the edge of night all alone in the greyness, the nightingale's
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: only rival; a rival like some unknown in the midst of a crowd who for a
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: moment leads some well-loved song, in notes more liquid than a
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: master-singer's; and all the crowd joins in and his voice is lost, and
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: no one learns his name. At once a host of birds answered him out of dim
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: bushes, whose shapes had barely as yet emerged from night. And in this
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: chorus Perez awoke, and even Morano.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: They all three breakfasted together, and then the wanderers said
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: good-bye to Perez. And soon he was gone with his bright blue sash,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: drifting homewards with the Segre, well paid yet singing a little sadly
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: as he drifted; for he had been one of a quest, and now he left it at
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the edge of adventure, near solemn mountains and, beyond them,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: romantic, near-unknown lands. So Perez left and Rodriguez and Morano
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: turned again to the road, all the more lightly because they had not
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: done a full day's march for so long, and now a great one unrolled its
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: leagues before them.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: The heads of the mountains showed themselves again. They tramped as in
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the early days of their quest. And as they went the mountains,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: unveiling themselves slowly, dropping film after film of distance that
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: hid their mighty forms, gradually revealed to the wanderers the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: magnificence of their beauty. Till at evening Rodriguez and Morano
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: stood on a low hill, looking at that tremendous range, which lifted far

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley

author: Dunsany, Lord
