author: Dunsany, Lord

text: move farther off?"
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Before the next night was passed Rodriguez' dream might come true!
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And then the man came to the door anxious at hearing strange voices;
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: and Morano questioned him too, but he understood never a word. He was a
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: French farmer that had married a Spanish girl, out of the wonderful
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: land beyond the mountains: but whether he understood her or not he
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: never understood Spanish. But both Rodriguez and the farmer's wife knew
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the two languages, and he had no difficulty in asking for lodging for
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the night; and she looked wistfully at him going to the wars, for in
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: those days wars were small and not every man went. The night went by
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: with dreams that were all on the verge of waking, which passed like
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: ghosts along the edge of night almost touched by the light of day. It
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: was Rodriguez whom these dreams visited. The farmer and his wife
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: wondered awhile and then slept; Morano slept with all his wonted
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: lethargy; but Rodriguez with his long quest now on the eve of
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: fulfilment slept a tumultuous sleep. Sometimes his dreams raced over
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the Pyrenees, running south as far as Lowlight; and sometimes they
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: rushed forward and clung like bats to the towers of the great castle
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: that he should win in the war. And always he lay so near the edge of
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: sleep that he never distinguished quite between thought and dream.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Dawn came and he put by all the dreams but the one that guided him
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: always, and went and woke Morano. They ate hurriedly and left the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: house, and again the farmer's wife looked curiously at Rodriguez, as
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: though there were something strange in a man that went to wars: for
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: those days were not as these days. They followed the direction that had
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: been given them, and never had the two men walked so fast. By the end
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: of four hours they had done sixteen miles. They halted then, and Morano
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: drew out his frying-pan with a haughty flourish, and cooked in the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: grand manner, every movement he made was a triumphant gesture; for they
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: had passed refugees! War was now obviously close: they had but to take
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the way that the refugees were not taking. The dream was true: Morano
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: saw himself walking slowly in splendid dress along the tapestried
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: corridors of his master's castle. He would have slept after eating and
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: would have dreamed more of this, but Rodriguez commanded him to put the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: things together: so what remained of the food disappeared again in a
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: sack, the frying-pan was slung over his shoulders, and Morano stood
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: ready again for the road.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: They passed more refugees: their haste was unmistakable, and told more
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: than their lips could have told had they tarried to speak: the wars
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: were near now, and the wanderers went leisurely.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: As they strolled through the twilight they came over the brow of a
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: hill, a little fold of the earth disturbed eras ago by the awful
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: rushing up of the Pyrenees; and they saw the evening darkening over the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: fields below them and a white mist rising only just clear of the grass,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: and two level rows of tents greyish-white like the mist, with a few
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: more tents scattered near them. The tents had come up that evening with
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the mist, for there were men still hammering pegs. They were lighting
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: fires now as evening settled in. Two hundred paces or so separated each
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: row. It was two armies facing each other.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: The gloaming faded: mist and the tents grew greyer: camp-fires blinked
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: out of the dimness and grew redder and redder, and candles began to be
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: lit beside the tents till all were glowing pale golden: Rodriguez and
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Morano stood there wondering awhile as they looked on the beautiful
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: aura that surrounds the horrors of war.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: They came by starlight to that tented field, by twinkling starlight to
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the place of Rodriguez' dream.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "For which side will you fight, master?" said Morano in his ear.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "For the right," said Rodriguez and strode on towards the nearest
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: tents, never doubting that he would be guided, though not trying to
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: comprehend how this could be.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: They met with an officer going among his tents. "Where do you go?" he
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: shouted.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Senor," Rodriguez said, "I come with my mandolin to sing songs to you."
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And at this the officer called out and others came from their tents;
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: and Rodriguez repeated his offer to them not without confidence, for he
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: knew that he had a way with the mandolin. And they said that they
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: fought a battle on the morrow and could not listen to song: they heaped
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: scorn on singing for they said they must needs prepare for the fight:
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: and all of them looked with scorn on the mandolin. So Rodriguez bowed
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: low to them with doffed hat and left them; and Morano bowed also,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: seeing his master bow; and the men of that camp returned to their
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: preparations. A short walk brought Rodriguez and his servant to the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: other camp, over a flat field convenient for battle. He went up to a
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: large tent well lit, the door being open towards him; and, having
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: explained his errand to a sentry that stood outside, he entered and saw
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: three persons of quality that were sitting at a table. To them he bowed
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: low in the tent door, saying: "Senors, I am come to sing songs to you,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: playing the while upon my mandolin."
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And they welcomed him gladly, saying: "We fight tomorrow and will
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: gladly cheer our hearts with the sound of song and strengthen our men
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: thereby."
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And so Rodriguez sang among the tents, standing by a great fire to
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: which they led him; and men came from the tents and into the circle of
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: light, and in the darkness outside it were more than Rodriguez saw. And
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: he sang to the circle of men and the vague glimmer of faces. Songs of
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: their homes he sang them, not in their language, but songs that were
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: made by old poets about the homes of their infancy, in valleys under
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: far mountains remote from the Pyrenees. And in the song the yearnings
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: of dead poets lived again, all streaming homeward like swallows when
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the last of the storms is gone: and those yearnings echoed in the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: hearts that beat in the night around the campfire, and they saw their
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: own homes. And then he began to touch his mandolin; and he played them
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the tunes that draw men from their homes and that march them away to
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: war. The tunes flowed up from the firelight: the mandolin knew. And the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: men heard the mandolin saying what they would say.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: In the late night he ended, and a hush came down on the camp while the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: music floated away, going up from the dark ring of men and the fire-lit
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: faces, touching perhaps the knees of the Pyrenees and drifting thence
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: wherever echoes go. And the sparks of the camp-fire went straight
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: upwards as they had done for hours, and the men that sat around it saw
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: them go: for long they had not seen the sparks stream upwards, for
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: their thoughts were far away with the mandolin. And all at once they
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: cheered. And Rodriguez bowed to the one whose tent he had entered, and
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: sought permission to fight for them in the morning.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: With good grace this was accorded him, and while he bowed and well
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: expressed his thanks he felt Morano touching his elbow. And as soon as
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: he had gone aside with Morano that fat man's words bubbled over and
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: were said.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Master, fight not for these men," he exclaimed, "for they listen to
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: song till midnight while the others prepare for battle. The others will
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: win the fight, master, and where will your castle be?"
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Morano," said Rodriguez, "there seems to be truth in that. Yet must we
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: fight for the right. For how would it be if those that have denied song
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: should win and thrive? The arm of every good man must be against them.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: They have denied song, Morano! We must fight against them, you and I,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: while we can lay sword to head."
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Yes, indeed, master," said Morano. "But how shall you come by your
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: castle?"
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "As for that," said Rodriguez, "it must some day be won, yet not by
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: denying song. These have given a welcome to song, and the others have
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: driven it forth. And what would life be if those that deny song are to
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: be permitted to thrive unmolested by all good men?"
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "I know not, master," said Morano, "but I would have that castle."
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Enough," said Rodriguez. "We must fight for the right."
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And so Rodriguez remained true to those that had heard him sing. And
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: they gave him a casque and breast-plate, proof, they said, against any
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: sword, and offered a sword that they said would surely cleave any
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: breast-plate. For they fought not in battle with the nimble rapier. But
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Rodriguez did not forsake that famous exultant sword whose deeds he
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: knew from many an ancient song; which he had brought so far to give it
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: its old rich drink of blood. He believed it the bright key of the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: castle he was to win.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And they gave Rodriguez a good bed on the ground in the tent of the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: three leaders, the tent to which he first came; for they honoured him
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: for the gift of song that he had, and because he was a stranger, and
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: because he had asked permission to fight for them in their battle. And
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Rodriguez took one look by the light of a lantern at the rose he had
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: carried from Lowlight, then slept a sleep through whose dreams loomed
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: up the towers of castles.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Dawn came and he slept on still; but by seven all the camp was loudly
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: astir, for they had promised the enemy to begin the battle at eight.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Rodriguez breakfasted lightly; for, now that the day of his dreams was
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: come at last and all his hopes depended on the day, an anxiety for many
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: things oppressed him. It was as though his castle, rosy and fair in
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: dreams, chilled with its huge cold rocks all the air near it: it was as
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: though Rodriguez touched it at last with his hands and felt a dankness
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: of which he had never dreamed.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Then it came to the hour of eight and his anxieties passed.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: The army was now drawn up before its tents in line, but the enemy was
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: not yet ready and so they had to wait.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: When the signal at length was given and the cannoniers fired their
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: pieces, and the musketoons were shot off, many men fell. Now Rodriguez,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: with Morano, was placed on the right, and either through a slight
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: difference in numbers or because of an unevenness in the array of
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: battle they a little overlapped the enemy's left. When a few men fell
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: wounded there by the discharge of the musketoons this overlapping was
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: even more pronounced.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Now the leaders of that fair army scorned all unknightly devices, and
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: would never have descended to any vile ruse de guerre. The reproach can
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: therefore never be made against them that they ever intended to
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: outflank their enemy. Yet, when both armies advanced after the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: occurred as the result of chance, which no leader can be held
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: accountable for; so that those that speak of treachery in this battle,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: and deliberate outflanking, lie.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Now Rodriguez as he advanced with his sword, when the musketoons were
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: those opposite to him, before any smoke should obscure them, and had
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: selected the one who from the splendour of his dress might be expected

text: to possess the finest castle. Certainly this adversary outshone those

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Rodriguez marched.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Then began fighting foot to foot, and there was a pretty laying on of
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: swords. And had there been a poet there that day then the story of
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
