text: "My castle, senor?" said his prisoner weakly.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Yes," said Rodriguez impatiently.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Yes, senor," said his adversary and closed his eyes for awhile.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Does he surrender his castle, master?" asked Morano.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Yes, indeed," said Rodriguez. They looked at each other: all at last
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: was well.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: The battle was rolling away from them and was now well within the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: enemy's tents.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: History says of that day that the good men won. And, sitting, a Muse
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: upon her mythical mountain, her decision must needs be one from which
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: we may not appeal: and yet I wonder if she is ever bribed. Certainly
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the shrewd sense of Morano erred for once; for those for whom he had
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: predicted victory, because they prepared so ostentatiously upon the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: field, were defeated; while the others, having made their preparations
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: long before, were able to cheer themselves with song before the battle
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: and to win it when it came.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And so Rodriguez was left undisturbed in possession of his prisoner and
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: with the promise of his castle as a ransom. The battle was swiftly
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: over, as must needs be where little armies meet so close. The enemy's
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: camp was occupied, his army routed, and within an hour of beginning the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: battle the last of the fighting ceased.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: The army returned to its tents to rejoice and to make a banquet,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: bringing with them captives and horses and other spoils of war. And
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Rodriguez had honour among them because he had fought on the right and
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: so was one of those that had broken the enemy's left, from which
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: direction victory had come. And they would have feasted him and done
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: him honour, both for his work with the sword and for his songs to the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: mandolin; and they would have marched away soon to their own country
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: and would have taken him with them and advanced him to honour there.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: But Rodriguez would not stay with them for he had his castle at last,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: and must needs march off at once with his captive and Morano to see the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: fulfilment of his dream. And therefore he thanked the leaders of that
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: host with many a courtesy and many a well-bent bow, and explained to
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: them how it was about his castle, and felicitated them on the victory
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: of their good cause, and so wished them farewell. And they said
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: farewell sorrowfully: but when they saw he would go, they gave him
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: horses for himself and Morano, and another for his captive; and they
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: heaped them with sacks of provender and blankets and all things that
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: could give him comfort upon a journey: all this they brought him out of
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: their spoils of war, and they would give him no less that the most that
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the horses could carry. And then Rodriguez turned to his captive again,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: who now stood on his feet.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Senor," he said, "pray tell us all of your castle wherewith you ransom
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: your life."
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Senor," he answered, "I have a castle in Spain."
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Master," broke in Morano, his eyes lighting up with delight, "there
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: are no castles like the Spanish ones."
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: They got to horse then, all three; the captive on a horse of far poorer
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: build than the other two and well-laden with sacks, for Rodriguez took
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: no chance of his castle cantering, as it were, away from him on four
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: hooves through the dust.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And when they heard that his journey was by way of the Pyrenees four
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: knights of that army swore they would ride with him as far as the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: frontier of Spain, to bear him company and bring him fuel in the lonely
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: cold of the mountains. They all set off and the merry army cheered. He
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: left them making ready for their banquet, and never knew the cause for
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: which he had fought.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: They came by evening again to the house to which Rodriguez had come two
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: nights before, when he had slept there with his castle yet to win. They
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: all halted before it, and the man and the woman came to the door
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: terrified. "The wars!" they said.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "The wars," said one of the riders, "are over, and the just cause has
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: won."
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "The Saints be praised!" said the woman. "But will there be no more
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: fighting?"
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Never again," said the horseman, "for men are sick of gunpowder."
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "The Saints be thanked," she said.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Say not that," said the horseman, "for Satan invented gunpowder."
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And she was silent; but, had none been there, she had secretly thanked
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Satan.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: They demanded the food and shelter that armed men have the right to
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: demand.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: In the morning they were gone. They became a memory, which lingered
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: like a vision, made partly of sunset and partly of the splendour of
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: their cloaks, and so went down the years that those two folk had, a
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: thing of romance, magnificence and fear. And now the slope of the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: mountain began to lift against them, and they rode slowly towards those
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: unearthly peaks that had deserted the level fields before ever man came
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: to them, and that sat there now familiar with stars and dawn with the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: air of never having known of man. And as they rode they talked. And
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Rodriguez talked with the four knights that rode with him, and they
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: told tales of war and told of the ways of fighting of many men: and
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Morano rode behind them beside the captive and questioned him all the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: morning about his castle in Spain. And at first the captive answered
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: his questions slowly, as if he were weary, or as though he were long
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: from home and remembered its features dimly; but memory soon returned
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: and he answered clearly, telling of such a castle as Morano had not
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: dreamed; and the eyes of the fat man bulged as he rode beside him,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: growing rounder and rounder as they rode.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: They came by sunset to that wood of firs in which Rodriguez had rested.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: In the midst of the wood they halted and tethered their horses to
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: trees; they tied blankets to branches and made an encampment; and in
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the midst of it they made a fire, at first, with pine-needles and the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: dead lower twigs and then with great logs. And there they feasted
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: together, all seven, around the fire. And when the feast was over and
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the great logs burning well, and red sparks went up slowly towards the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: silver stars, Morano turned to the prisoner seated beside him and "Tell
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the senors," he said, "of my master's castle."
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And in the silence, that was rather lulled than broken by the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: whispering wind from the snow that sighed through the wood, the captive
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: slowly lifted up his head and spoke in his queer accent.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Senors, in Aragon, across the Ebro, are many goodly towers." And as he
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: spoke they all leaned forward to listen, dark faces bright with
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: firelight. "On the Ebro's southern bank stands," he went on, "my home."
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: He told of strange rocks rising from the Ebro; of buttresses built
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: among them in unremembered times; of the great towers lifting up in
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: multitudes from the buttresses; and of the mighty wall, windowless
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: until it came to incredible heights, where the windows shone all safe
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: from any ladder of war.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: At first they felt in his story his pride in his lost home, and
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: wondered, when he told of the height of his towers, how much he added
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: in pride. And then the force of that story gripped them all and they
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: doubted never a battlement, but each man's fancy saw between firelight
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: and starlight every tower clear in the air. And at great height upon
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: those marvellous towers the turrets of arches were; queer carvings
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: grinned down from above inaccessible windows; and the towers gathered
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: in light from the lonely air where nothing stood but they, and flashed
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: it far over Aragon; and the Ebro floated by them always new, always
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: amazed by their beauty.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: He spoke to the six listeners on the lonely mountain, slowly,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: remembering mournfully; and never a story that Romance has known and
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: told of castles in Spain has held men more than he held his listeners,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: while the sparks flew up toward the peaks of the Pyrenees and did not
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: reach to them but failed in the night, giving place to the white stars.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And when he faltered through sorrow, or memory weakening, Morano
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: always, watching with glittering eyes, would touch his arm, sitting
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: beside him, and ask some question, and the captive would answer the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: question and so talk sadly on.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: He told of the upper terraces, where heliotrope and aloe and oleander
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: took sunlight far above their native earth: and though but rare winds
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: carried the butterflies there, such as came to those fragrant terraces
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: lingered for ever.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And after a while he spoke on carelessly, and Morano's questions ended,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: and none of the men in the firelight said a word; but he spoke on
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: uninterrupted, holding them as by a spell, with his eyes fixed far away
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: on black crags of the Pyrenees, telling of his great towers: almost it
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: might have seemed he was speaking of mountains. And when the fire was
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: only a deep red glow and white ash showed all round it, and he ceased
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: speaking, having told of a castle marvellous even amongst the towers of
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Spain: all sitting round the embers felt sad with his sadness, for his
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: sad voice drifted into their very spirits as white mists enter houses,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: and all were glad when Rodriguez said to him that one of his ten tall
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: towers the captive should keep and should live in it for ever. And the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: sad man thanked him sadly and showed no joy.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: When the tale of the castle and those great towers was done, the wind
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: that blew from the snow touched all the hearers; they had seemed to be
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: away by the bank of the Ebro in the heat and light of Spain, and now
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the vast night stripped them and the peaks seemed to close round on
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: them. They wrapped themselves in blankets and lay down in their
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: shelters. For a while they heard the wind waving branches and the thump
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: of a horse's hoof restless at night; then they all slept except one
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: that guarded the captive, and the captive himself who long lay thinking
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: and thinking.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Dawn stole through the wood and waked none of the sleepers; the birds
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: all shouted at them, still they slept on; and then the captive's guard
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: wakened Morano and he stirred up the sparks of the fire and cooked, and
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: they breakfasted late. And soon they left the wood and faced the bleak
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: slope, all of them going on foot and leading their horses.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And the track crawled on till it came to the scorn of the peaks,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: winding over a shoulder of the Pyrenees, where the peaks gaze cold and
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: contemptuous away from the things of man.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: In the presence of those that bore them company Rodriguez and Morano
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: felt none of the deadly majesty of those peaks that regard so awfully
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: over the solitudes. They passed through them telling cheerfully of wars
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the four knights had known: and descended and came by sunset to the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: lower edge of the snow. They pushed on a little farther and then
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: camped; and with branches from the last camp that they had heaped on
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: their horses they made another great fire and, huddling round it in the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: blankets that they had brought, found warmth even there so far from the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: hearths of men.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And dawn and the cold woke them all on that treeless slope by barely
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: warm embers. Morano cooked again and they ate in silence. And then the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: four knights rose sadly and one bowed and told Rodriguez how they must
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: now go back to their own country. And grief seized on Rodriguez at his
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: words, seeing that he was to lose four old friends at once and perhaps
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: for ever, for when men have fought under the same banner in war they
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: become old friends on that morning.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Senors," said Rodriguez, "we may never meet again!"
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And the other looked back to the peaks beyond which the far lands lay,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: and made a gesture with his hands.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Senor, at least," said Rodriguez, "let us camp once more together."
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And even Morano babbled a supplication.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Methinks, senor," he answered, "we are already across the frontier,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: and when we men of the sword cross frontiers misunderstandings arise,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: so that it is our custom never to pass across them save when we push
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the frontier with us, adding the lands over which we march to those of
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: our liege lord."
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Senors," said Rodriguez, "the whole mountain is the frontier. Come
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: with us one day further." But they would not stay.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: All the good things that could be carried they loaded on to the three
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: horses whose heads were turned towards Spain; then turned, all four,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: and said farewell to the three. And long looked each in the face of
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Rodriguez as he took his hand in fare well, for they had fought under
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the same banner and, as wayfaring was in those days, it was not likely
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: that they would ever meet again. They turned and went with their horses
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: back towards the land they had fought for.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Rodriguez and his captive and Morano went sadly down the mountain. They
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: came to the fir woods, and rested, and Morano cooked their dinner. And
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: after a while they were able to ride their horses.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: They came to the foot of the mountains, and rode on past the Inn of the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: World's End. They camped in the open; and all night long Rodriguez or
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Morano guarded the captive.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: For two days and part of the third they followed their old course,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: catching sight again and again of the river Segre; and then they turned
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: further west ward to come to Aragon further up the Ebro. All the way
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: they avoided houses and camped in the open, for they kept their captive
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: to themselves: and they slept warm with their ample store of blankets.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And all the while the captive seemed morose or ill at ease, speaking
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: seldom and, when he did, in nervous jerks.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Morano, as they rode, or by the camp fire at evening, still questioned
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: him now and then about his castle; and sometimes he almost seemed to
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: contradict himself, but in so vast a castle may have been many styles
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: of architecture, and it was difficult to trace a contradiction among
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: all those towers and turrets. His name was Don
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Alvidar-of-the-Rose-pink-Castle on-Ebro.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: One night while all three sat and gazed at the camp-fire as men will,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: when the chilly stars are still and the merry flames are leaping,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Rodriguez, seeking to cheer his captive's mood, told him some of his
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: strange adventures. The captive listened with his sombre air. But when
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Rodriguez told how they woke on the mountain after their journey to the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: sun; and the sun was shining on their faces in the open, but the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: magician and his whole house were gone; then there came another look
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: into Alvidar's eyes. And Rodriguez ended his tale and silence fell,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: broken only by Morano saying across the fire, "It is true," and the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: captive's thoughtful eyes gazed into the darkness. And then he also
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: spoke.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Senor," he said, "near to my rose-pink castle which looks into the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Ebro dwells a magician also."
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Is it so?" said Rodriguez.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Indeed so, senor," said Don Alvidar. "He is my enemy but dwells in awe
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: of me, and so durst never molest me except by minor wonders."
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "How know you that he is a magician?" said Rodriguez.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "By those wonders," answered his captive. "He afflicts small dogs and
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: my poultry. And he wears a thin, high hat: his beard is also
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: extraordinary."
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Long?" said Morano.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Green," answered Don Alvidar.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Is he very near the castle?" said Rodriguez and Morano together.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Too near," said Don Alvidar.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Is his house wonderful?" Rodriguez asked.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "It is a common house," was the answer. "A mean, long house of one
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: story. The walls are white and it is well thatched. The windows are
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: painted green; there are two doors in it and by one of them grows a
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: rose tree."
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "A rose tree?" exclaimed Rodriguez.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "It seemed a rose tree," said Don Alvidar.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "A captive lady chained to the wall perhaps, changed by magic,"
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: suggested Morano.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Perhaps," said Don Alvidar.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "A strange house for a magician," said Rodriguez, for it sounded like
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: any small farmhouse in Spain.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "He much affects mortal ways," replied Don Alvidar.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Little more was then said, the fire being low: and Rodriguez lay down
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: to sleep while Morano guarded the captive.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And the day after that they came to Aragon, and in one day more they
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: were across the Ebro; and then they rode west for a day along its
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: southern bank looking all the while as they rode for Rodriguez' castle.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And more and more silent and aloof, as they rode, grew Don
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Alvidar-of-the-Rose-pink-Castle-on-Ebro.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And just before sunset a cry broke from the captive. "He has taken it!"
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: he said. And he pointed to just such a house as he had described, a
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: jolly Spanish farmhouse with white walls and thatch and green shutters,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: and a rose tree by one of the doors just as he had told.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "The magician's house. But the castle is gone," he said.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Rodriguez looked at his face and saw real alarm in it. He said nothing
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: but rode on in haste, a dim hope in his mind that explanations at the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: white cottage might do something for his lost castle.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And when the hooves were heard a woman came out of the cottage door by
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the rose tree leading a small child by the hand. And the captive called
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: to the woman, "Maria, we are lost. And I gave my great castle with
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: rose-pink towers that stood just here as ransom to this senor for my
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: life. But now, alas, I see that that magician who dwelt in the house
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: where you are now has taken it whither we know not."
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Yes, Pedro," said the woman, "he took it yesterday." And she turned
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: blue eyes upon Rodriguez.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And then Morano would be silent no longer. He had thought vaguely for
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: some days and intensely for the last few hundreds yards, and now he
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: blurted out the thoughts that boiled in him.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Master," he shouted, "he has sold his cattle and bought this raiment
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: of his, and that helmet that you opened up for him, and never had any
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: castle on the Ebro with any towers to it, and never knew any magician,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: but lived in this house himself, and now your castle is gone, master,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: and as for his life ..."
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Be silent a moment, Morano," said Rodriguez, and he turned to the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: woman whose eyes were on him still.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Was there a castle in this place?" he said.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Yes, senor. I swear it," she said. "And my husband, though a poor man,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: always spoke the truth."
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "She lies," said Morano, and Rodriguez silenced him with a gesture.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "I will get neighbours who will swear it too," she said.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "A lousy neighbourhood," said Morano.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Again Rodriguez silenced him. And then the child spoke in a frightened
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: voice, holding up a small cross that it had been taught to revere. "I
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: swear it too," it said.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Rodriguez heaved a sigh and turned away. "Master," Morano cried in
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: pained astonishment, "you will not believe their swearings."
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "The child swore by the cross," he answered.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "But, master!" Morano exclaimed.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: But Rodriguez would say no more. And they rode away aimless in silence.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Galloping hooves were heard and Pedro was there. He had come to give up
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: his horse. He gave its reins to the scowling Morano but Rodriguez said
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: never a word. Then he ran round and kissed Rodriguez' hand, who still
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: was silent, for his hopes were lost with the castle; but he nodded his
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: head and so parted for ever from the man whom his wife called Pedro,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: who called himself Don Alvidar-of-the-Rose-pink-Castle-on-Ebro.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: THE TENTH CHRONICLE
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: HOW HE CAME BACK TO LOWLIGHT
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Master," Morano said. But Rodriguez rode ahead and would not speak.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: They were riding vaguely southward. They had ample provisions on the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: horse that Morano led, as well as blankets, which gave them comfort at
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: night. That night they both got the sleep they needed, now that there
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: was no captive to guard. All the next day they rode slowly in the April
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: weather by roads that wandered among tended fields; but a little way
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: off from the fields there shone low hills in the sunlight, so wild, so
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: free of man, that Rodriguez remembering them in later years, wondered
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: if their wild shrubs just hid the frontiers of fairyland.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: For two days they rode by the edge of unguessable regions. Had Pan
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: piped there no one had marvelled, nor though fauns had scurried past
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: sheltering clumps of azaleas. In the twilight no tiny queens had court
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: within rings of toadstools: yet almost, almost they appeared.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And on the third day all at once they came to a road they knew. It was
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the road by which they had ridden when Rodriguez still had his dream,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the way from Shadow Valley to the Ebro. And so they turned into the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: road they knew, as wanderers always will; and, still without aim or
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: plan, they faced towards Shadow Valley. And in the evening of the day
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: that followed that, as they looked about for a camping-ground, there
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: came in sight the village on the hill which Rodriguez knew to be fifty
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: miles from the forest: it was the village in which they had rested the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: first night after leaving Shadow Valley. They did not camp but went on
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: to the village and knocked at the door of the inn. Habit guides us all
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: at times, even kings are the slaves of it (though in their presence it
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: takes the prouder name of precedent); and here were two wanderers
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: without any plans at all; they were therefore defenceless in the grip
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: of habit and, seeing an inn they knew, they loitered up to it. Mine
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: host came again to the door. He cheerfully asked Rodriguez how he had
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: fared on his journey, but Rodriguez would say nothing. He asked for
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: lodging for himself and Morano and stabling for the horses: he ate and
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: slept and paid his due, and in the morning was gone.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Whatever impulses guided Rodriguez as he rode and Morano followed, he
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: knew not what they were or even that there could be any. He followed
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the road without hope and only travelled to change his camping-grounds.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And that night he was half-way between the village and Shadow Valley.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Morano never spoke, for he saw that his master's disappointment was
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: still raw; but it pleased him to notice, as he had done all day, that
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: they were heading for the great forest. He cooked their evening meal in
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: their camp by the wayside and they both ate it in silence. For awhile
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Rodriguez sat and gazed at the might-have-beens in the camp-fire: and
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: when these began to be hidden by white ash he went to his blankets and
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: slept. And Morano went quietly about the little camp, doing all that
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: needed to be done, with never a word. When the horses were seen to and
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: fed, when the knives were cleaned, when everything was ready for the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: start next morning, Morano went to his blankets and slept too. And in
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the morning again they wandered on.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: That evening they saw the low gold rays of the sun enchanting the tops
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: of a forest. It almost surprised Rodriguez, travelling without an aim,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: to recognise Shadow Valley. They quickened their slow pace and, before
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: twilight faded, they were under the great oaks; but the last of the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: twilight could not pierce the dimness of Shadow Valley, and it seemed
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: as if night had entered the forest with them.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: They chose a camping-ground as well as they could in the darkness and
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Morano tied the horses to trees a little way off from the camp. Then he
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: returned to Rodriguez and tied a blanket to the windward side of two
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: trees to make a kind of bedroom for his master, for they had all the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: blankets they needed. And when this was done he set the emblem and
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: banner of camps, anywhere all over the world in any time, for he
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: gathered sticks and branches and lit a camp-fire. The first red flames
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: went up and waved and proclaimed a camp: the light made a little
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: circle, shadows ran away to the forest, and the circle of light on the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: ground and on the trees that stood round it became for that one night
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: home.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: They heard the horses stamp as they always did in the early part of the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: night; and then Morano went to give them their fodder. Rodriguez sat
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: and gazed into the fire, his mind as full of thoughts as the fire was
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: full of pictures: one by one the pictures in the fire fell in; and all
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: his thoughts led nowhere.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: He heard Morano running back the thirty or forty yards he had gone from
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the camp-fire "Master," Morano said, "the three horses are gone."
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Gone?" said Rodriguez. There was little more to say; it was too dark
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: to track them and he knew that to find three horses in Shadow Valley
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: was a task that might take years. And after more thought than might
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: seem to have been needed he said; "We must go on foot."
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Have we far to go, master?" said Morano, for the first time daring to
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: question him since they left the cottage in Spain.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "I have nowhere to go," said Rodriguez. His head was downcast as he sat
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: by the fire: Morano stood and looked at him unhappily, full of a
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: sympathy that he found no words to express. A light wind slipped
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: through the branches and everything else was still. It was some while
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: before he lifted his head; and then he saw before him on the other side
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: of the fire, standing with folded arms, the man in the brown leather
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: jacket.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Nowhere to go!" said he. "Who needs go anywhere from Shadow Valley?"
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Rodriguez stared at him. "But I can't stay here!" he said.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "There is no fairer forest known to man," said the other. "I know many
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: songs that prove it."
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Rodriguez made no answer but dropped his eyes, gazing with listless
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: glance once more at the ground. "Come, senor," said the man in the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: leather jacket. "None are unhappy in Shadow Valley."
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Who are you?" said Rodriguez. Both he and Morano were gazing curiously
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: at the man whom they had saved three weeks ago from the noose.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Your friend," answered the stranger.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "No friend can help me," said Rodriguez.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Senor," said the stranger across the fire, still standing with folded
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: arms, "I remain under an obligation to no man. If you have an enemy or
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: love a lady, and if they dwell within a hundred miles, either shall be
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: before you within a week."
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Rodriguez shook his head, and silence fell by the camp-fire. And after
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: awhile Rodriguez, who was accustomed to dismiss a subject when it was
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: ended, saw the stranger's eyes on him yet, still waiting for him to say
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: more. And those clear blue eyes seemed to do more than wait, seemed
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: almost to command, till they overcame Rodriguez' will and he obeyed and
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: said, although he could feel each word struggling to stay unuttered,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Senor, I went to the wars to win a castle and a piece of land thereby;
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: and might perchance have wed and ended my wanderings, with those of my
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: servant here; but the wars are over and no castle is won."
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And the stranger saw by his face in the firelight, and knew from the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: tones of his voice in the still night, the trouble that his words had
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: not expressed.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "I remain under an obligation to no man," said the stranger. "Be at
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: this place in four weeks' time, and you shall have a castle as large as
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: any that men win by war, and a goodly park thereby."
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Your castle, master!" said Morano delighted, whose only thought up to
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: then was as to who had got his horses. But Rodriguez only stared: and
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the stranger said no more but turned on his heel. And then Rodriguez
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: awoke out of his silence and wonder. "But where?" he said. "What
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: castle?"
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "That you will see," said the stranger.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "But, but how ..." said Rodriguez. What he meant was, "How can I
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: believe you?" but he did not put it in words.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "My word was never broken," said the other. And that is a good boast to
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: make, for those of us who can make it; if we need boast at all.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Whose word?" said Rodriguez, looking him in the eyes.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: The smoke from the fire between them was thickening greyly as though
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: something had been cast on it. "The word," he said, "of the King of
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Shadow Valley."
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Rodriguez gazing through the increasing smoke saw not to the other
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: side. He rose and walked round the fire, but the strange man was gone.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Rodriguez came back to his place by the fire and sat long there in
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: silence. Morano was bubbling over to speak, but respected his master's
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: silence: for Rodriguez was gazing into the deeps of the fire seeing
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: pictures there that were brighter than any that he had known. They were
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: so clear now that they seemed almost true. He saw Serafina's face there
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: looking full at him. He watched it long until other pictures hid it,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: visions that had no meaning for Rodriguez. And not till then he spoke.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And when he spoke his face was almost smiling.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Well, Morano," he said, "have we come by that castle at last?"
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "That man does not lie, master," he answered: and his eyes were
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: glittering with shrewd conviction.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "What shall we do then?" said Rodriguez.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Let us go to some village, master," said Morano, "until the time he
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: said."
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "What village?" Rodriguez asked.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "I know not, master," answered Morano, his face a puzzle of innocence
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: and wonder; and Rodriguez fell back into thought again. And the dancing
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: flames calmed down to a deep, quiet glow; and soon Rodriguez stepped
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: back a yard or two from the fire to where Morano had prepared his bed;
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: and, watching the fire still, and turning over thoughts that flashed
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: and changed as fast as the embers, he went to wonderful dreams that
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: were no more strange or elusive than that valley's wonderful king.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: When he spoke in the morning the camp-fire was newly lit and there was
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: a smell of bacon; and Morano, out of breath and puzzled, was calling to
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: him.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Master," he said, "I was mistaken about those horses."
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Mistaken?" said Rodriguez.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "They were just as I left them, master, all tied to the tree with my
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: knots."
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Rodriguez left it at that. Morano could make mistakes and the forest
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: was full of wonders: anything might happen. "We will ride," he said.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Morano's breakfast was as good as ever; and, when he had packed up
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: those few belongings that make a dwelling-place of any chance spot in
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the wilderness, they mounted the horses, which were surely there, and
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: rode away through sunlight and green leaves. They rode slow, for the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: branches were low over the path, and whoever canters in a forest and
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: them to be whipped by the next branch or close them till he bumps his
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: head into a tree. And it suited Rodriguez to loiter, for he thought
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: thus to meet the King of Shadow Valley again or his green bowmen and
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: learn the answers to innumerable questions about his castle which were
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: wandering through his mind.

author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: They ate and slept at noon in the forest's glittering greenness.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: They passed afterwards by the old house in the wood, in which the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: bowmen feasted, for they followed the track that they had taken before.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: They knocked loud on the door as they passed but the house was empty.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: They heard the sound of a multitude felling trees, but whenever they
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: approached the sound of chopping ceased. Again and again they left the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: track and rode towards the sound of chopping, and every time the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: chopping died away just as they drew close. They saw many a tree half
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: felled, but never a green bowman. And at last they left it as one of
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: struck their camp and were riding on.

author: Dunsany, Lord

author: Dunsany, Lord

author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

author: Dunsany, Lord
