title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: camp-fire, so that when they awoke there was still fire in the embers
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And when they had eaten their breakfast Rodriguez said farewell to
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Morano, saying that he had business in Lowlight that might keep him a
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: few days. But Morano said not farewell then, for he would follow his
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: master as far as the midday halt to cook his next meal. And when noon
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: came they were beyond the forest.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Once more Morano cooked bacon. Then while Rodriguez slept Morano took
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: his cloak and did all that could be done by brushing and smoothing to
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: give back to it that air that it some time had, before it had flapped
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: upon so many winds and wrapped Rodriguez on such various beds, and met
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the vicissitudes that make this story.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: For the plume he could do little.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And his master awoke, late in the afternoon, and went to his horse and
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: gave Morano his orders. He was to go back with two of the horses to
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: their last camp in the forest and take with him all their kit except
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: one blanket and make himself comfortable there and wait till Rodriguez
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: came.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And then Rodriguez rode slowly away, and Morano stood gazing mournfully
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: and warningly at the mandolin; and the warnings were not lost upon
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Rodriguez, though he would never admit that he saw in Morano's staring
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: eyes any wise hint that he heeded.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And Morano sighed, and went and untethered his horses; and soon he was
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: riding lonely back to the forest. And Rodriguez taking the other way
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: saw at once the towers of Lowlight.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Does my reader think that he then set spurs to his horse, galloping
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: towards that house about whose balcony his dreams flew every night? No,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: it was far from evening; far yet from the colour and calm in which the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: light with never a whisper says farewell to Earth, but with a gesture
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: that the horizon hides takes silent leave of the fields on which she
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: has danced with joy; far yet from the hour that shone for Serafina like
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: a great halo round her and round her mother's house.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: We cannot believe that one hour more than another shone upon Serafina,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: or that the dim end of the evening was only hers: but these are the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Chronicles of Rodriguez, who of all the things that befell him
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: treasured most his memory of Serafina in the twilight, and who held
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: that this hour was hers as much as her raiment and her balcony: such
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: therefore it is in these chronicles.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And so he loitered, waiting for the slow sun to set: and when at last a
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: tint on the walls of Lowlight came with the magic of Earth's most faery
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: hour he rode in slowly not perhaps wholly unwitting, for all his
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: anxious thoughts of Serafina, that a little air of romance from the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Spring and the evening followed this lonely rider.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: From some way off he saw that balcony that had drawn him back from the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: other side of the far Pyrenees. Sometimes he knew that it drew him and
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: mostly he knew it not; yet always that curved balcony brought him
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: nearer, ever since he turned from the field of the false Don Alvidar:
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the balcony held him with invisible threads, such as those with which
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Earth draws in the birds at evening. And there was Serafina in her
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: balcony.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: When Rodriguez saw Serafina sitting there in the twilight, just as he
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: had often dreamed, he looked no more but lowered his head to the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: withered rose that he carried now in his hand, the rose that he had
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: found by that very balcony under another moon. And, gazing still at the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: rose, he rode on under the balcony, and passed it, until his hoof-beats
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: were heard no more in Lowlight and he and his horse were one dim shape
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: between the night and the twilight. And still he held on.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: He knew not yet, but only guessed, who had thrown that rose from the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: balcony on the night when he slept on the dust: he knew not who it was
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: that he fought on the same night, and dared not guess what that unknown
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: hidalgo might be to Serafina. He had no claim to more from that house,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: which once gave him so cold a welcome, than thus to ride by it in
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: silence. And he knew as he rode that the cloak and the plume that he
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: wore scarce seemed the same as those that had floated by when more than
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: a month ago he had ridden past that balcony; and the withered rose that
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: he carried added one more note of autumn. And yet he hoped.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And so he rode into twilight and was hid from the sight of the village,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: a worn, pathetic figure, trusting vaguely to vague powers of good
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: fortune that govern all men, but that favour youth.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And, sure enough, it was not yet wholly moonlight when cantering hooves
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: came down the road behind him. It was once more that young hidalgo. And
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: as soon as he drew rein beside Rodriguez both reached out merry hands
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: as though their former meeting had been some errand of joy. And as
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Rodriguez looked him in the eyes, while the two men leaned over
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: clasping hands, in light still clear though faded, he could not doubt
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Serafina was his sister.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Senor," said his old enemy, "will you tarry with us, in our house a
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: few days, if your journey is not urgent?"
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Rodriguez gasped for joy; for the messenger from Lowlight, the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: certainty that here was no rival, the summons to the house of his
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: dreams' pilgrimage, came all together: his hand still clasped the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: stranger's. Yet he answered with the due ceremony that that age and
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: land demanded: then they turned and rode together towards Lowlight. And
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: first the young men told each other their names; and the stranger told
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: how he dwelt with his mother and sister in the house that Rodriguez
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: knew, and his name was Don Alderon of the Valley of Dawnlight. His
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: house had dwelt in that valley since times out of knowledge; but then
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the Moors had come and his forbears had fled to Lowlight: the Moors
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: were gone now, for which Saint Michael and all fighting Saints be
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: praised; but there were certain difficulties about his right to the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Valley of Dawnlight. So they dwelt in Lowlight still.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And Rodriguez told of the war that there was beyond the Pyrenees and
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: how the just cause had won, but little more than that he was able to
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: tell, for he knew scarce more of the cause for which he had fought than
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: History knows of it, who chooses her incidents and seems to forget so
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: much. And as they talked they came to the house with the balcony. A
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: waning moon cast light over it that was now no longer twilight; but was
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the light of wild things of the woods, and birds of prey, and men in
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: mountains outlawed by the King, and magic, and mystery, and the quests
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: of love. Serafina had left her place: lights gleamed now in the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: windows. And when the door was opened the hall seemed to Rodriguez so
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: much less hugely hollow, so much less full of ominous whispered echoes,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: that his courage rose high as he went through it with Alderon, and they
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: entered the room together that they had entered together before. In the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: long room beyond many candles he saw Dona Serafina and her mother
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: rising up to greet him. Neither the ceremonies of that age nor
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Rodriguez' natural calm would have entirely concealed his emotion had
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: not his face been hidden as he bowed. They spoke to him; they asked him
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: of his travels; Rodriguez answered with effort. He saw by their manner
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: that Don Alderon must have explained much in his favour. He had this
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: time, to cheer him, a very different greeting; and yet he felt little
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: more at ease than when he had stood there late at night before, with
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: one eye bandaged and wearing only one shoe, suspected of he knew not
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: what brawling and violence.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: It was not until Dona Mirana, the mother of Serafina, asked him to play
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: to them on his mandolin that Rodriguez' ease returned. He bowed then
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: and brought round his mandolin, which had been slung behind him; and
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: knew a triumphant champion was by him now, one old in the ways of love
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: and wise in the sorrows of man, a slender but potent voice,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: well-skilled to tell what there were not words to say; a voice
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: unhindered by language, unlimited even by thought, whose universal
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: meaning was heard and understood, sometimes perhaps by wandering
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: spirits of light, beaten far by some evil thought for their heavenly
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: courses and passing close along the coasts of Earth.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And Rodriguez played no tune he had ever known, nor any airs that he
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: had heard men play in lanes in Andalusia; but he told of things that he
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: knew not, of sadnesses that he had scarcely felt and undreamed
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: exaltations. It was the hour of need, and the mandolin knew.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And when all was told that the mandolin can tell of whatever is
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: wistfulest in the spirit of man, a mood of merriment entered its old
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: curved sides and there came from its hollows a measure such as they
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: dance to when laughter goes over the greens in Spain. Never a song sang
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Rodriguez; the mandolin said all.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And what message did Serafina receive from those notes that were
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: strange even to Rodriguez? Were they not stranger to her? I have said
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: that spirits blown far out of their course and nearing the mundane
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: coasts hear mortal music sometimes, and hearing understand. And if they
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: cannot understand those snatches of song, all about mortal things and
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: human needs, that are wafted rarely to them by chance passions, how
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: much more surely a young mortal heart, so near Rodriguez, heard what he
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: would say and understood the message however strange.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: When Dona Mirana and her daughter rose, exchanging their little
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: curtsies for the low bows of Rodriguez, and so retired for the night,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the long room seemed to Rodriguez now empty of threatening omens. The
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: great portraits that the moon had lit, and that had frowned at him in
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the moonlight when he came here before, frowned at him now no longer.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: The anger that he had known to lurk in the darkness on pictured faces
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: of dead generations had gone with the gloom that it haunted: they were
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: all passionless now in the quiet light of the candles. He looked again
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: at the portraits eye to eye, remembering looks they had given him in
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the moonlight, and all looked back at him with ages of apathy; and he
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: knew that whatever glimmer of former selves there lurks about portraits
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: of the dead and gone was thinking only of their own past days in years
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: remote from Rodriguez. Whether their anger had flashed for a moment
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: over the ages on that night a month from now, or whether it was only
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the moonlight, he never knew. Their spirits were back now surely
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: amongst their own days, whence they deigned not to look on the days
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: that make these chronicles.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Not till then did Rodriguez admit, or even know, that he had not eaten
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: since his noonday meal. But now he admitted this to Don Alderon's
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: questions; and Don Alderon led him to another chamber and there regaled
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: him with all the hospitality for which that time was famous. And when
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Rodriguez had eaten, Don Alderon sent for wine, and the butler brought
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: it in an olden flagon, dark wine of a precious vintage: and soon the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: two young men were drinking together and talking of the wickedness of
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the Moors. And while they talked the night grew late and chilly and
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: still, and the hour came when moths are fewer and young men think of
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: bed. Then Don Alderon showed his guest to an upper room, a long room
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: dim with red hangings, and carvings in walnut and oak, which the one
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: candle he carried barely lit but only set queer shadows scampering. And
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: here he left Rodriguez, who was soon in bed, with the great red
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: hangings round him. And awhile he wondered at the huge silence of the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: house all round him, with never a murmur, never an echo, never a sigh;
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: for he missed the passing of winds, branches waving, the stirring of
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: small beasts, birds of prey calling, and the hundred sounds of the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: night; but soon through the silence came sleep.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: He did not need to dream, for here in the home of Serafina he had come
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: to his dreams' end.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Another day shone on another scene; for the sunlight that went in a
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: narrow stream of gold and silver between the huge red curtains had sent
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: away the shadows that had stalked overnight through the room, and had
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: scattered the eeriness that had lurked on the far side of furniture,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: and all the dimness was gone that the long red room had harboured. And
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: for a while Rodriguez did not know where he was; and for a while, when
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: he remembered, he could not believe it true. He dressed with care,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: almost with fear, and preened his small moustachios, which at last had
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: grown again just when he would have despaired. Then he descended, and
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: found that he had slept late, though the three of that ancient house
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: were seated yet at the table, and Serafina all dressed in white seemed
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: to Rodriguez to be shining in rivalry with the morning. Ah dreams and
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: fancies of youth!

author: Dunsany, Lord

author: Dunsany, Lord

author: Dunsany, Lord

text: HOW HE TURNED TO GARDENING AND HIS SWORD RESTED

text: These were the days that Rodriguez always remembered; and, side by side
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: with them, there lodged in his memory, and went down with them into his
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: latter years, the days and nights when he went through the Pyrenees and
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: walked when he would have slept but had to walk or freeze: and by some
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: queer rule that guides us he treasured them both in his memory, these
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: happy days in this garden and the frozen nights on the peaks.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley

text: For Serafina showed Rodriguez the garden that behind the house ran
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: narrow and long to the wild. There were rocks with heliotrope pouring
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: over them and flowers peeping behind them, and great azaleas all in
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: triumphant bloom, and ropes of flowering creepers coming down from
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: trees, and oleanders, and a plant named popularly Joy of the South, and
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: small paths went along it edged with shells brought from the far sea.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: There was only one street in the village, and you did not go far among
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the great azaleas before you lost sight of the gables; and you did not
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: go far before the small paths ended with their shells from the distant
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: sea, and there was the mistress of all gardeners facing you, Mother
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: garden than those that grew in the garden of Dona Mirana; and she too
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: had little paths, only they were without borders and without end. Yet
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: looking from the long and narrow garden at the back of that house in
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Lowlight to the wider garden that sweeps round the world, and is fenced
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: by Space from the garden in Venus and by Space from the garden in Mars,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: you scarce saw any difference or noticed where they met: the solitary
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: azaleas beyond were gathered together by distance, and from Lowlight to
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the horizon seemed all one garden in bloom. And afterwards, all his
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: years, whenever Rodriguez heard the name of Spain, spoken by loyal men,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: it was thus that he thought of it, as he saw it now.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And here he used to walk with Serafina when she tended flowers in the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: cool of the morning or went at evening to water favourite blooms. And
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Rodriguez would bring with him his mandolin, and sometimes he touched
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: it lightly or even sang, as they rested on some carved seat at the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: garden's end, looking out towards shadowy shrubs on the shining hill,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: but mostly he heard her speak of the things she loved, of what moths
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: flew to their garden, and which birds sang, and how the flowers grew.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Serafina sat no longer in her balcony but, disguising idleness by other
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: names, they loitered along those paths that the seashells narrowed; yet
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: there was a grace in their loitering such as we have not in our dances
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: now. And evening stealing in from the wild places, from darkening
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: azaleas upon distant hills, still found them in the garden, found
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: magnolia that the wind had wounded. Almost unnoticed by him the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: sunlight would disappear, and the coloured blaze of the sunset, and
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: then the gloaming; till the colours of all the flowers queerly changed
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: and they shone with that curious glow which they wear in the dusk. They
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: discussing the future of the world, Rodriguez holding that it was
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: it would all go to the Moors.

author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Days passed thus.

author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And then one evening Rodriguez was in the garden with Serafina; the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: flowers, dim and pale and more mysterious than ever, poured out their
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: scent towards the coming night, luring huge hawk-moths from the far
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: understanding evening all it was able to tell; and after that cry,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: grown piteous with so many human longings, for it was an old mandolin,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: went dumb and mournful.

author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: mandolin's high mood. His eyes said, and his sighs told, what the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

author: Dunsany, Lord

author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: curving slope of dimly glowing azaleas, "You like flowers, senor?"

author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Indeed?" said Dona Serafina.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Indeed I do," said Rodriguez.

author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "And yet," asked Dona Serafina, "was it not a somewhat withered or
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "It was indeed faded," said Rodriguez, "for the rose was some weeks
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley

text: old."
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "One who loved flowers, I thought," said Serafina, "would perhaps care
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: more for them fresh."
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Half-dumb though Rodriguez was his shrewdness did not desert him. To
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Senorita," he said, "I found the flower on holy ground."
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "I did not know," she said, "that you had travelled so far."
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "I found it here," he said, "under your balcony."
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Perchance I let it fall," said she. "It was idle of me."
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "I guard it still," he said, and drew forth that worn brown rose.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "It was idle of me," said Serafina.

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the ghost of that rose introduced their spirits one to the other, so
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley

author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley

author: Dunsany, Lord

text: appeared. It was Venus watching lovers, as men of the crumbled
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: of the wing from which it came; on darting journeys outspeeding the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley

text: songs; and the galleon goes nameless by till the singing dies away.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: What ship was it? Whither bound? Why there? Enough that he has seen it.

author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley

text: and youth is like some high headland from which to see.

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley

text: reader may. He turned to Don Alderon, who was surprised to see the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: vehemence with which his guest suddenly spoke after those hours of
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: silence, and Rodriguez told him the story of his love and the story of
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: both his castles, that which had vanished from the bank of the Ebro and
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Oh, Rodriguez," he said, "you are welcome to our ancient, unfortunate
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: house": and later he said, "I have met no man that had a prettier way
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley

text: with the sword."
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

author: Dunsany, Lord

text: But Rodriguez held on to the end, telling all he had to tell; and
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: especially that he was landless and penniless but for that one promise;
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: and as for the sword, he said, he was but as a child playing before the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: sword of Don Alderon. And this Don Alderon said was in no wise so,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: though there were a few cunning passes that he had learned, hoping that
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: of the Moors: and heartily he gave his consent and felicitation. But
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: this Rodriguez would not have: "Come with me," he said, "to the forest
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: to the place where I met this man, and if we find him not there we will
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Gladly indeed," said Don Alderon. "We will start tomorrow."
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And Rodriguez took his words literally, though his host had meant no
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: more than what we should call "one of these days," but Rodriguez was
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: being consumed with a great impatience. And so they arranged it, and
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Don Alderon went to bed with a feeling, which is favourable to dreams,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: that on the next day they went upon an adventure; for neither he nor
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Once more next morning Rodriguez walked with Serafina, with something
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: of the romance of the garden gone, for Dona Mirana walked there too;
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: and romance is like one of those sudden, wonderful colours that flash
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: for a moment out of a drop of dew; a passing shadow obscures them; and
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: ask another to see it, and the colour is not the same: move but a yard
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: and the ray of enchantment is gone. Dona Mirana saw the romance of that
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: garden, but she saw it from thirty years away; it was all different
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: what she saw, all changed from a certain day (for love was love in the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: old days): and to Rodriguez and Serafina it seemed that she could not
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: evening.

author: Dunsany, Lord

author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And then Rodriguez told Serafina that he was riding away with her
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: brother to see about the affairs of his castle, and that they would
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: not prosper, for he trusted the word of the King of Shadow Valley. His
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: away together.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Soon in the distance they saw Shadow Valley. And then Rodriguez
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: bethought him of Morano and of the foul wrong he committed against Don
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Alderon with his frying-pan, and how he was there in the camp to which
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: he was bringing his friend. And so he said: "That vile knave Morano
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: still lives and insists on serving me."
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "If he be near," said Don Alderon, "I pray you to disarm him of his
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: frying-pan for the sake of my honour, which does not suffer me to be
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: stricken with culinary weapons, but only with the sword, the lance, or
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: even bolts of cannon or arquebuss ..." He was thinking of yet more
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: weapons when Rodriguez put spurs to his horse. "He is near," he said;
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "I will ride on and disarm him."
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: So Rodriguez came cantering into the forest while Don Alderon ambled a
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: mile or so behind him.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And there he found his old camp and saw Morano, sitting upon the ground
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: by a small fire. Morano sprang up at once with joy in his eyes, his
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: face wreathed with questions, which he did not put into words for he
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: did not pry openly into his master's affairs.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Morano," said Rodriguez, "give me your frying-pan."
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "My frying-pan?" said Morano.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Yes," said Rodriguez. And when he held in his hand that blackened,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: greasy utensil he told Morano, "That senor you met in Lowlight rides
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: with me."
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: The cheerfulness faded out of Morano's face as light fades at sunset.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Master," he said, "he will surely slay me now."
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "He will not slay you," said Rodriguez.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Master," Morano said, "he hopes for my fat carcase as much as men hope
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: for the unicorn, when they wear their bright green coats and hunt him
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: with dogs in Spring." I know not what legend Morano stored in his mind,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: nor how much of it was true. "And when he finds me without my
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: frying-pan he will surely slay me."
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "That senor," said Rodriguez emphatically, "must not be hit with the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: frying-pan."
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "That is a hard rule, master," said Morano.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And Rodriguez was indignant, when he heard that, that anyone should
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: thought was upon the injustice of giving up the sweets of life for the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: sake of a frying-pan. Thus they were at cross-purposes. And for some
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: while they stood silent, while Rodriguez hung the reins of his horse
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: over the broken branch of a tree. And then Don Alderon rode into the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: wood.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: All then that was most pathetic in Morano's sense of injustice looked
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: out of his eyes as he turned them upon his master. But Don Alderon
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: scarcely glanced at all at Morano, even when he handed to him the reins
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: of his horse as he walked on towards Rodriguez.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And there in that leafy place they rested all through the evening, for
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: they had not started so early upon their journey as travellers should.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Eight days had gone since Rodriguez had left that small camp to ride to
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Lowlight, and to the apex of his life towards which all his days had
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: ascended; and in that time Morano had collected good store of wood and,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: in little ways unthought of by dwellers in cities, had made the place
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: like such homes as wanderers find. Don Alderon was charmed with their
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: roof of towering greenness, and with the choirs of those which
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: inhabited it and which were now all coming home to sing. And at some
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: moment in the twilight, neither Rodriguez nor Alderon noticed when,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: but acting on a certain tacit permission that there seemed to be in the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: twilight or in the mood of the two young men as they sat by the fire.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And soon he was cooking once more, at a fire of his own, with something
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: of the air that you see upon a Field Marshal's face who has lost his
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: baton and found it again. Have you ever noticed it, reader?
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And when the meal was ready Morano served it in silence, moving
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: unobtrusively in the gloom of the wood; for he knew that he was
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: forgiven, yet not so openly that he wished to insist on his presence or
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: even to imply his possession of the weapon that fried the bacon. So,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: watching the sparks go up on innumerable journeys from the fire at
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: which they sat, to be lost to sight in huge wastes of blackness and
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: we know.

author: Dunsany, Lord

author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: halted on account of the attraction that one of his old camps seems to
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: have for a wanderer. It drew his feet towards it, this blackened
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley

author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

author: Dunsany, Lord

text: these chronicles can tell.

author: Dunsany, Lord

author: Dunsany, Lord

author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

author: Dunsany, Lord

author: Dunsany, Lord

author: Dunsany, Lord

author: Dunsany, Lord

author: Dunsany, Lord

author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

author: Dunsany, Lord

author: Dunsany, Lord

text: where they could get the horses through. Finding the chains go on and
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley

text: where Morano was.

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: foot, leading their horses, towards this gate; but their way was slow
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: and difficult for no path at all led up to it. It was dark when they
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: when he had feasted with the green bowmen.

author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley

author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: There they camped as well as men can when darkness has fallen before
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley

author: Dunsany, Lord

author: Dunsany, Lord

author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: no step but theirs stirred in the forest. Then, leaving Morano in the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: camp with its great gate that led nowhere, the two young men climbed up
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: by branches and chains, and were soon on the other side of the gate and
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: pressing on through the silence of the forest to find the cottage in
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: which Rodriguez had slept. And almost at once the green bowmen
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley

author: Dunsany, Lord

author: Dunsany, Lord

author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Where is he?" asked Rodriguez.

author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Then show me the castle that he promised me," said Rodriguez.

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley

author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley

author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "Has the King of Shadow Valley no castle?" he asked, beginning now to
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: despair.

author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: any castle of which their King was possessed; and each of them said
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: that there was no castle in all Shadow Valley. The ten still stood in
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

author: Dunsany, Lord

author: Dunsany, Lord

author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: that these ten bowmen did not know the whole world; but he could not
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: cheer Rodriguez. For, sitting there in dejection on his log, thinking
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

author: Dunsany, Lord

author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

author: Dunsany, Lord

author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: was silent.

author: Dunsany, Lord

author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley

author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
