author: Dunsany, Lord

text: forest's elders, of which nearly a hundred were fallen when evening
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: came. And the stoutest of these, great trunks that were four feet
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: through, were dragged by horses to the bowmen's cottage and laid by the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: little sticks that the King of Shadow Valley had put overnight in the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: ground. The bowmen's cottage and the kitchen that was in the wood
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: behind it, and a few trees that still stood, were now all enclosed by
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: four lines of fallen trees which made a large rectangle on the ground
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: with a small square at each of its corners. And craftsmen came, and
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: smoothed and hollowed the inner sides of the four rows of trees,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: working far into the night. So was the first day's work accomplished
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: and so was built the first layer of the walls of Castle Rodriguez.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: On the next day the bowmen again felled a hundred trees; the top of the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: first layer was cut flat by carpenters; at evening the second layer was
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: hoisted up after their under sides had been flattened to fit the layer
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: below them; quantities more were cast in to make the floor when they
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: had been gradually smoothed and fitted: at the end of the second day a
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: man could not see over the walls of Castle Rodriguez. And on the third
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: day more craftsmen arrived, men from distant villages at the forest's
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: edge, whence the King of Shadow Valley had summoned them; and they
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: carved the walls as they grew. And a hundred trees fell that day, and
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the castle was another layer higher. And all the while a park was
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: growing in the forest, as they felled the great trees; but the greatest
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: trees of all the bowmen spared, oaks that had stood there for ages and
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: ages of men; they left them to grip the earth for a while longer, for a
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: few more human generations.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: On the fourth day the two windows at the back of the bowmen's cottage
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: began to darken, and that evening Castle Rodriguez was fifteen feet
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: high. And still the hundred bowmen hewed at the forest, bringing
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: sunlight bright on to grass that was shadowed by oaks for ages. And at
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the end of the fifth day they began to roof the lower rooms and make
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: their second floor: and still the castle grew a layer a day, though the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: second storey they built with thinner trees that were only three feet
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: through, which were more easily carried to their place by the pulleys.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And now they began to heap up rocks in a mass of mortar against the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: wall on the outside, till a steep slope guarded the whole of the lower
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: part of the castle against fire from any attacker if war should come
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: that way, in any of the centuries that were yet to be: and the deep
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: windows they guarded with bars of iron.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: The shape of the castle showed itself clearly now, rising on each side
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: of the bowmen's cottage and behind it, with a tower at each of its
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: corners. To the left of the old cottage the main doorway opened to the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: great hall, in which a pile of a few huge oaks was being transformed
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: into a massive stair. Three figures of strange men held up this ceiling
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: with their heads and uplifted hands, when the castle was finished; but
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: as yet the carvers had only begun their work, so that only here and
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: there an eye peeped out, or a smile flickered, to give any expression
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: to the curious faces of these fabulous creatures of the wood, which
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: were slowly taking their shape out of three trees whose roots were
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: still in the earth below the floor. In an upper storey one of these
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: trees became a tall cupboard; and the shelves and the sides and the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: back and the top of it were all one piece of oak.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: All the interior of the castle was of wood, hollowed into alcoves and
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: polished, or carved into figures leaning out from the walls. So vast
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: were the timbers that the walls, at a glance, seemed almost one piece
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: of wood. And the centuries that were coming to Spain darkened the walls
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: as they came, through autumnal shades until they were all black, as
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: though they all mourned in secret for lost generations; but they have
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: not yet crumbled.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: The fireplaces they made with great square red tiles, which they also
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: put in the chimneys amongst rude masses of mortar: and these great dark
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: holes remained always mysterious to those that looked for mystery in
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the family that whiled away the ages in that castle. And by every
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: fireplace two queer carved creatures stood upholding the mantlepiece,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: with mystery in their faces and curious limbs, uniting the hearth with
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: fable and with tales told in the wood. Years after the men that carved
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: them were all dust the shadows of these creatures would come out and
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: dance in the room, on wintry nights when all the lamps were gone and
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: flames stole out and flickered above the smouldering logs.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: In the second storey one great saloon ran all the length of the castle.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: In it was a long table with eight legs that had carvings of roses
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: rambling along its edges: the table and its legs were all of one piece
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: with the floor. They would never have hollowed the great trunk in time
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: had they not used fire. The second storey was barely complete on the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: day that Rodriguez and Don Alderon and Morano came to the chains that
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: guarded the park. And the King of Shadow Valley would not permit his
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: gift to be seen in anything less than its full magnificence, and had
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: commanded that no man in the world might enter to see the work of his
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: bowmen and craftsmen until it should frown at all comers a castle
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: formidable as any in Spain.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And then they heaped up the mortar and rock to the top of the second
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: storey, but above that they let the timbers show, except where they
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: filled in plaster between the curving trunks: and the ages blackened
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the timber in amongst the white plaster; but not a storm that blew in
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: all the years that came, nor the moss of so many Springs, ever rotted
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: away those beams that the forest had given and on which the bowmen had
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: laboured so long ago. But the castle weathered the ages and reached our
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: days, worn, battered even, by its journey through the long and
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: sometimes troubled years, but splendid with the traffic that it had
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: with history in many gorgeous periods. Here Valdar the Excellent came
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: once in his youth. And Charles the Magnificent stayed a night in this
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: castle when on a pilgrimage to a holy place of the South.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: It was here that Peter the Arrogant in his cups gave Africa, one Spring
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: night, to his sister's son. What grandeurs this castle has seen! What
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: chronicles could be writ of it! But not these chronicles, for they draw
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: near their close, and they have yet to tell how the castle was built.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Others shall tell what banners flew from all four of its towers, adding
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: a splendour to the wind, and for what cause they flew. I have yet to
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: tell of their building.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: The second storey was roofed, and Castle Rodriguez still rose one layer
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: day by day, with a hauling at pulleys and the work of a hundred men:
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: and all the while the park swept farther into the forest.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And the trees that grew up through the building were worked by the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: craftsmen in every chamber into which they grew: and a great branch of
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the hugest of them made a little crooked stair in an upper storey. On
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the floors they laid down skins of beasts that the bowmen slew in the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: forest; and on the walls there hung all manner of leather, tooled and
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: dyed as they had the art to do in that far-away period in Spain.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: When the third storey was finished they roofed the castle over, laying
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: upon the huge rafters red tiles that they made of clay. But the towers
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: were not yet finished.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: At this time the King of Shadow Valley sent a runner into Lowlight to
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: shoot a blunt arrow with a message tied to it into Don Alderon's
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: garden, near to the door, at evening.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And they went on building the towers above the height of the roof And
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: near the top of them they made homes for archers, little turrets that
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: leaned like swallows' nests out from each tower, high places where they
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: could see and shoot and not be seen from below. And little narrow
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: passages wound away behind perched battlements of stone, by which
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: archers could slip from place to place, and shoot from here or from
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: there and never be known. So were built in that distant age the towers
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: of Castle Rodriguez.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And one day four weeks from the felling of the first oak, the period of
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: his promise being accomplished, the King of Shadow Valley blew his
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: horn. And standing by what had been the bowmen's cottage, now all shut
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: in by sheer walls of Castle Rodriguez, he gathered his bowmen to him.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And when they were all about him he gave them their orders. They were
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: to go by stealth to the village of Lowlight, and were to be by daylight
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: before the house of Don Alderon; and, whether wed or unwed, whether she
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: fled or folk defended the house, to bring Dona Serafina of the Valley
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: of Dawnlight to be the chatelaine of Castle Rodriguez.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: For this purpose he bade them take with them a chariot that he thought
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: magnificent, though the mighty timbers that gave grandeur to Castle
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Rodriguez had a cumbrous look in the heavy vehicle that was to the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: bowmen's eyes the triumphal car of the forest. So they took their bows
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: and obeyed, leaving the craftsmen at their work in the castle, which
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: was now quite roofed over, towers and all. They went through the forest
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: by little paths that they knew, going swiftly and warily in the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: bowmen's way: and just before nightfall they were at the forest's edge,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: though they went no farther from it than its shadows go in the evening.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And there they rested under the oak trees for the early part of the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: night except those whose art it was to gather news for their king; and
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: three of those went into Lowlight and mixed with the villagers there.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: When white mists moved over the fields near dawn and wavered ghostly
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: about Lowlight, the green bowman moved with them. And just out of
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: hearing of the village, behind wild shrubs that hid them, the bowmen
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: that were coming from the forest met the three that had spent the night
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: in taverns of Lowlight. And the three told the hundred of the great
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: wedding that there was to be in the Church of the Renunciation that
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: morning in Lowlight: and of the preparations that were made, and how
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: holy men had come from far on mules, and had slept the night in the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: village, and the Bishop of Toledo himself would bless the bridegroom's
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: sword. The bowmen therefore retired a little way and, moving through
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the mists, came forward to points whence they could watch the church,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: well concealed on the wild plain, which here and there gave up a field
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: to man but was mostly the playground of wild creatures whose ways were
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the bowmen's ways. And here they waited.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: This was the wedding of Rodriguez and Serafina, of which gossips often
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: spoke at their doors in summer evenings, old women mumbling of fair
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: weddings that each had seen; and they had been children when they saw
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: this wedding; they were those that threw small handfuls of anemones on
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the path before the porch. They told the tale of it till they could
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: tell no more. It is the account of the last two or three of them, old,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: old women, that came at last to these chronicles, so that their tongues
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: may wag as it were a little longer through these pages although they
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: have been for so many centuries dead. And this is all that books are
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: able to do.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: First there was bell-ringing and many voices, and then the voices
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: hushed, and there came the procession of eight divines of Murcia, whose
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: vestments were strange to Lowlight. Then there came a priest from the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: South, near the border of Andalusia, who overnight had sanctified the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: ring. (It was he who had entertained Rodriguez when he first escaped
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: from la Garda, and Rodriguez had sent for him now.) Each note of the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: bells came clear through the hush as they entered the church. And then
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: with suitable attendants the bishop strode by and they saw quite close
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the blessed cope of Toledo. And the bridegroom followed him in, wearing
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: his sword, and Don Alderon went with him. And then the voices rose
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: again in the street: the bells rang on: they all saw Dona Mirana. The
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: little bunches of bright anemones grew sticky in their hands: the bells
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: seemed louder: cheering rose in the street and came all down it nearer.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Then Dona Serafina walked past them with all her maids: and that is
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: what the gossips chiefly remembered, telling how she smiled at them,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: and praising her dress, through those distant summer evenings. Then
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: there was music in the church. And afterwards the forest-people had
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: come. And the people screamed, for none knew what they would do. But
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: they bowed so low to the bride and bridegroom, and showed their great
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: hunting bows so willingly to all who wished to see, that the people
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: lost their alarm and only feared lest the Bishop of Toledo should blast
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the merry bowmen with one of his curses.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And presently the bride and bridegroom entered the chariot, and the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: people cheered; and there were farewells and the casting of flowers;
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: and the bishop blessed three of their bows; and a fat man sat beside
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the driver with folded arms, wearing bright on his face a look of
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: foolish contentment; and the bowmen and bride and bridegroom all went
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: away to the forest.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Four huge white horses drew that bridal chariot, the bowmen ran beside
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: it, and soon it was lost to sight of the girls that watched it from
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Lowlight; but their memories held it close till their eyes could no
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: longer see to knit and they could only sit by their porches in fine
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: weather and talk of the days that were.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: So came Rodriguez and his bride to the forest; he silent, perplexed,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: wondering always to what home and what future he brought her; she
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: knowing less than he and trusting more. And on the untended road that
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the bowmen shared with stags and with rare, very venturous travellers,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the wheels of the woodland chariot sank so deep in the sandy earth that
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the escort of bowmen needed seldom to run any more; and he who sat by
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the driver climbed down and walked silent for once, perhaps awed by the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: occasion, though he was none other than Morano. Serafina was delighted
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: with the forest, but between Rodriguez and its beautiful grandeur his
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: anxieties crowded thickly. He leaned over once from the chariot and
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: asked one of the bowmen again about that castle; but the bowman only
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: bowed and answered with a proverb of Spain, not easily carried so far
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: from its own soil to thrive in our language, but signifying that the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: morrow showeth all things. He was silent then, for he knew that there
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: was no way to a direct answer through those proverbs, and after a while
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: perhaps there came to him some of Serafina's trustfulness. By evening
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: they came to a wide avenue leading to great gates.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Rodriguez did not know the avenue, he knew no paths so wide in Shadow
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Valley; but he knew those gates. They were the gates of iron that led
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: nowhere. But now an avenue went from them upon the other side, and
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: opened widely into a park dotted with clumps of trees. And the two
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: great iron shields, they too had changed with the changes that had
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: bewitched the forest, for their surfaces that had glowed so
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: unmistakably blank, side by side in the firelight, not many nights
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: before, blazoned now the armorial bearings of Rodriguez upon the one
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: and those of the house of Dawnlight upon the other. Through the opened
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: gates they entered the young park that seemed to wonder at its own
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: ancient trees, where wild deer drifted away from them like shadows
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: through the evening: for the bowmen had driven in deer for miles
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: through the forest. They passed a pool where water-lilies lay in
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: languid beauty for hundreds of summers, but as yet no flower peeped
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: into the water, for the pond was all hallowed newly.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: A clump of trees stood right ahead of their way; they passed round it;
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: and Castle Rodriguez came all at once into view. Serafina gasped
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: joyously. Rodriguez saw its towers, its turrets for archers, its
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: guarded windows deep in the mass of stone, its solemn row of
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: battlements, but he did not believe what he saw. He did not believe
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: that here at last was his castle, that here was his dream fulfilled and
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: his journey done. He expected to wake suddenly in the cold in some
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: lonely camp, he expected the Ebro to unfold its coils in the North and
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: to come and sweep it away. It was but another strayed hope, he thought,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: taking the form of dream. But Castle Rodriguez still stood frowning
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: there, and none of its towers vanished, or changed as things change in
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: dreams; but the servants of the King of Shadow Valley opened the great
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: door, and Serafina and Rodriguez entered, and all the hundred bowmen
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: disappeared.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Here we will leave them, and let these Chronicles end. For whoever
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: would tell more of Castle Rodriguez must wield one of those ponderous
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: pens that hangs on the study wall in the house of historians. Great
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: days in the story of Spain shone on those iron-barred windows, and
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: things were said in its banqueting chamber and planned in its inner
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: rooms that sometimes turned that story this way or that, as rocks turn
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: a young river. And as a traveller meets a mighty river at one of its
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: bends, and passes on his path, while the river sweeps on to its estuary
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: and the sea, so I leave the triumphs and troubles of that story which I
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: touched for one moment by the door of Castle Rodriguez.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: My concern is but with Rodriguez and Serafina and to tell that they
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: lived here in happiness; and to tell that the humble Morano found his
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: happiness too. For he became the magnificent steward of Castle
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Rodriguez, the majordomo, and upon august occasions he wore as much red
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: plush as he had ever seen in his dreams, when he saw this very event,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: sleeping by dying camp-fires. And he slept not upon straw but upon good
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: heaps of wolf-skins. But pining a little in the second year of his
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: somewhat lonely splendour, he married one of the maidens of the forest,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the child of a bowman that hunted boars with their king. And all the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: green bowmen came and built him a house by the gates of the park,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: whence he walked solemnly on proper occasions to wait upon his master.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Morano, good, faithful man, come forward for but a moment out of the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Golden Age and bow across all those centuries to the reader: say one
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: farewell to him in your Spanish tongue, though the sound of it be no
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: louder than the sound of shadows moving, and so back to the dim
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: splendour of the past, for the Senor or Senora shall hear your name no
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: more.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: For years Rodriguez lived a chieftain of the forest, owning the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: overlordship of the King of Shadow Valley, whom he and Serafina would
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: entertain with all the magnificence of which their castle was capable
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: on such occasions as he appeared before the iron gates. They seldom saw
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: him. Sometimes they heard his horn as he went by. They heard his bowmen
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: follow. And all would pass and perhaps they would see none. But upon
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: occasions he came. He came to the christening of the eldest son of
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Rodriguez and Serafina, for whom he was godfather. He came again to see
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the boy shoot for the first time with a bow. And later he came to give
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: little presents, small treasures of the forest, to Rodriguez'
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: daughters; who treated him always, not as sole lord of that forest that
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: travellers dreaded, but as a friend of their very own that they had
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: found for themselves. He had his favourites among them and none quite
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: knew which they were.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And one day he came in his old age to give Rodriguez a message. And he
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: spoke long and tenderly of the forest as though all its glades were
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: sacred.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And soon after that day he died, and was buried with the mourning of
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: all his men in the deeps of Shadow Valley, where only Rodriguez and the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: bowmen knew. And Rodriguez became, as the old king had commanded, the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: ruler of Shadow Valley and all its faithful men. With them he hunted
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: and defended the forest, holding all its ways to be sacred, as the old
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: king had taught. It is told how Rodriguez ruled the forest well.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And later he made a treaty with the Spanish King acknowledging him sole
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Lord of Spain, including Shadow Valley, saving that certain right
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: should pertain to the foresters and should be theirs for ever. And
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: these rights are written on parchment and sealed with the seal of
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Spain; and none may harm the forest without the bowmen's leave.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Rodriguez was made Duke of Shadow Valley and a Magnifico of the first
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: degree; though little he went with other hidalgos to Court, but lived
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: with his family in Shadow Valley, travelling seldom beyond the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: splendour of the forest farther than Lowlight.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Thus he saw the glory of autumn turning the woods to fairyland: and
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: when the stags were roaring and winter coming on he would take a
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: boar-spear down from the wall and go hunting through the forest, whose
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: twigs were black and slender and still against the bright menace of
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: winter. Spring found him viewing the fields that his men had sown,
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: along the forest's edge, and finding in the chaunt of the myriad birds
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: a stirring of memories, a beckoning towards past days. In summer he
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: would see his boys and girls at play, running through shafts of
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: sunlight that made leaves and grass like pale emeralds. He gave his
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: days to the forest and the four seasons. Thus he dwelt amidst
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: splendours such as History has never seen in any visit of hers to the
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: courts of men.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Of him and Serafina it has been written and sung that they lived
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: happily ever after; and though they are now so many centuries dead, may
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: they have in the memories of such of my readers as will let them linger
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: there, that afterglow of life that remembrance gives, which is all that
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: there is on earth for those that walked it once and that walk the paths
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: of their old haunts no more.
title: Don Rodriguez; Chronicles of Shadow Valley
